story:
The Parkinson Community Coalition is a non-profit organization functioning as the grass roots voice of people with Parkinson’s (PWPs) and their carepartners.  The Parkinson’s disease (PD) community doesn’t have a single organization to follow.  Instead, we have six major organizations.  We call them the Big Six.  Each organization has its own mission and purpose.  The problem is that there is very little consolidation of material or information, and some of their efforts are overlapping.  As a result, PWPs and their caregivers/carepartners don’t know who to listen to and sometimes receive conflicting information.  Even worse, time and money are being wasted on duplicated services.

     PCC is making it easier for people with Parkinson’s and their loved ones to get the information they need to not just cope with, but live well with this incurable, degenerative disease.

    The Parkinson Community Coalition is taking feedback directly from people in the Parkinson’s community and presenting their concerns in a unified voice directly to the six major Parkinson’s support organizations.  PCC is also sorting through the information currently available from the Big Six to provide a library of the best resource material from each organization.  PCC’s efforts will make it easier to receive useful resource material, reduce the waste of overlapping efforts between organizations, and let our voices be heard. 

 When are they doing it?

    PCC has already started making contacts with the right people in the Big Six, and have begun development and roll out of their first survey to tell the Big Six what they are doing right, and what they need to do better.

How can people help?

  The money raised through this campaign will be used to secure 501(c)3 status, develop a series of surveys designed to identify the frustrations of PWPs and their love ones, assess the data, and meet with the major PD organizations.  Money will also be used to organize the best available PD support material and make it easily accessible to the people who need it. 

    Your donation of any size is appreciated, and will make a difference. 

    Whether you donate or not you can still help.

  • Spread the word about the Parkinson Community Coalition. 
  • Share this Indiegogo donation page with your family, friends and support group members. 
  • Tell people about our web site: www.MyParkinsonCommunity.org.
  • Voice your opinion in our surveys.
    THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT.
story_txt:
The
Parkinson Community Coalition is a non-profit organization functioning as the
grass roots voice of people with Parkinson’s (PWPs) and their carepartners.  The
Parkinson’s disease (PD) community doesn’t have a single organization to follow.  Instead, we have six major organizations.  We call them the Big Six.  Each
organization has its own mission and purpose. 
The problem is that there is very little consolidation of material or
information, and some of their efforts are overlapping.  As a result, PWPs and their
caregivers/carepartners don’t know who to listen to and sometimes receive
conflicting information.  Even worse,
time and money are being wasted on duplicated services.
    

PCC is making
it easier for people with Parkinson’s and their loved ones to get the
information they need to not just cope with, but live well with this incurable, degenerative disease.
   
    The Parkinson Community Coalition is
taking feedback directly from people in the Parkinson’s community and
presenting their concerns in a unified voice directly to the six major
Parkinson’s support organizations.  PCC
is also sorting through the information currently available from the Big Six to
provide a library of the best resource material from each organization.  PCC’s efforts will make it easier to receive
useful resource material, reduce the waste of overlapping efforts between
organizations, and let our voices be heard. 

 When are they doing it?

    PCC has
already started making contacts with the right people in the Big Six, and have begun
development and roll out of their first survey to tell the Big Six what they are doing right, and what they need to do better.
How can people help?
  The money raised through this campaign will be used to secure 501(c)3 status, develop a series of surveys designed to identify the frustrations of PWPs and their love ones, assess the data, and meet with the major
PD organizations.  Money will also be used to organize the best available PD support material and make it easily accessible
to the people who need it.      Your donation of any size is appreciated, and will make a difference.      Whether you donate or not you can still help.
Spread the word about the Parkinson Community Coalition.  
Share this Indiegogo donation page with your family, friends and support group members.  

Tell people about our web site: www.MyParkinsonCommunity.org.

Voice your opinion in our surveys.

    THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT.

story:
Dear Donors and Supporters of disabled sportsmen,

My name is Wojciech Łukawski. I was disabled from birth due to cerebral palsy. At the time doctors said that I would never walk or speak. However, thanks to my parents, physiotherapists and some determination of my own, at the age of ten I made two unstable steps. Now aged twenty four, sport is my life!

As a member of the Beskidian Sports and Rehabilitation Union, known as START, based in my home town, Bielsko-Biała in southern Poland, I take part in the Polish National Championships in Para-cycling EDF Tour.

Soon I hope to start competing in marathons. However, to compete and win I need a new professional recumbent trike. At present I practice para-cycling on an English recumbent trike KMX Tornado. I have been training on this for 4 years doing 40-70 kms a day during weekends, and in spite of some necessary alterations it is now worn out and not speedy enough. My dream is to ride a VTX+ from England.

I have been involved in sport for as long as I can remember. Before I took my first steps I had been swimming and diving like a fish. Instead of using wheelchairs I insisted on riding tricycles and go-carts. Cycling has always given me a lot of joy, a sense of freedom and self-esteem.

I still have problems with independent walking, coordination and balance, but I have never given up trying to improve my competitive abilities. Perhaps people in other countries do not realize how difficult life is for disabled people in Poland. Support from the state is so poor that we ourselves have to collect the money for necessary therapies, rehabilitation and sports equipment.

I would be very grateful if you could help me raise the money for a new recumbent trike.

story:
Who We Are

Over 1.2 billion people have no access to electricity. 780 million lack access to clean water. Those aren’t just numbers- they’re people. Without energy access, millions are deprived of the most basic amenities that we take for granted every day. The world can no longer afford to ignore these challenges. Instead of turning a blind eye, why not do something about it?

Solar energy can be a part of this solution. United Solar Initiative (USI) is a non-profit organization led by students at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, Appalachian State University, and employees at Strata Solar, LLC. Our mission is to empower developing communities worldwide through solar energy solutions, while working to strengthen a growing industry. 

In the past, we have done solar installations on schools and community centers in Nicaragua to provide electricity for communities where there was no previous access.  For these communities, electricity has provided the capability to offer adult evening education classes for the members who work outdoors from sun up to sun down.  It also has allowed them to generate revenue--they offer a mobile phone charging service for a small fee.  

USI partners with NGOs that have connections to communities, ensuring relationships are developed as a key to a community’s long-term understanding and upkeep of the installations. We are grateful for the opportunities we have had to impact people's lives in Nicaragua and excited to offer a similar impact to communities in Mali.


What We Need

In early 2015, USI partnered with World Vision to bring power and clean water to communities all over the world. World Vision currently supports 2,000 water pumps throughout Africa, South America, and East Asia. USI will solarize 1,000 of these pumps over the next five years, replacing the hand crank or diesel fuel process with clean, electric-powered pumps.  We’re asking you to help us fund our first installation in Mali!

  • The estimated cost of our first project in Mali is $8,500. 


The Impact

Through this project and others, we hope to empower communities via more sustainable and productive living. We’re asking you to be a part of this movement--to create a cleaner world that empowers the lives of all people. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Donations of any kind are of course appreciated, but we understand that money can be hard to come by. If you can't contribute but think our project is cool, you can still get the word out!

  • Share this with your friends- yes anyone and everyone!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to let other people hear about us!

story:
TESTIMONIAL FROM DR. LESTER GRINSPOON, PROFESSOR EMERITUS AT HARVARD MEDICAL SCHOOL AND AUTHOR OF MARIJUANA: THE FORBIDDEN MEDICINE

"For more than two decades, WAMM has provided the world's best working model of a truly compassionate medical cannabis collective. WAMM has also brought healing, relief and integrative care to thousands of chronically and terminally ill members—many who otherwise could not afford this medicine—while helping pass America's first statewide medical marijuana law. They've even survived a DEA raid, and successfully sued the federal government in response. Please join me in supporting WAMM and Valerie Corral, so this world-class, truly grassroots organization can continue their invaluable work."

PRESS

Fighting Back in Santa Cruz: Pot Patients Sue the Feds (Alternet)

Defiant California City Hands Out Marijuana (New York Times )

Pot raid angers state, patients (USA Today)

Half An Ounce of Healing (Mother Jones)

A NOTE FROM VALERIE CORRAL

Founded in 1993, the Wo/Men’s Alliance for Medical Marijuana (WAMM) in Santa Cruz, California is the world’s oldest continuously operating medical cannabis collective. We focus on providing low-cost or no-cost organic, sun-grown cannabis and comprehensive, compassionate care to seriously ill patients unable to afford the high prices at dispensaries, including those suffering with cancer, HIV/AIDS, ALS, Alzheimer's, Multiple Sclerosis, PTSD, autism and pediatric epilepsy.

WAMM has eased hundreds of members through their final months by providing  end-of-life care through our sister hospice project, and we've also provided the medicine, knowledge and community support needed for many others to successfully treat serious conditions until they show no evidence of disease.

My own journey with medical marijuana began in the 1970’s, when my husband and I discovered that cannabis was far more effective in treating my debilitating gran mal epileptic seizures than pharmaceuticals, without all the dangerous side effects. So we started growing our own. And then, after a pair of arrests for cannabis cultivation, instead of backing down, we resolved to help others facing similar persecution.

So in 1996, I co-authored Proposition 215, America's first statewide medical marijuana law. And since then, what started as a handful of seriously ill patients banding together has grown into a vital collective that services hundreds of chronically and terminally ill members through grassroots community outreach.

That's why WAMM has always had the strong support of the city and county of Santa Cruz, but in 2002, the Drug Enforcement Agency raided our garden at gunpoint and destroyed our entire crop of state-legal medical cannabis. Several members died as a result of being cut off from their supply. In response, less than two weeks after the DEA raid, we gathered on the steps of City Hall, alongside the mayor of Santa Cruz and other local officials, to defiantly distribute free medicine to members. Next, WAMM successfully sued the federal government.

The garden was subsequently replanted, and grows more beautifully than ever. Most recently, we've been at the forefront of providing high-CBD medicine for children with epilepsy and other life-threatening conditions, and designing personalized, integrative cannabis-oil treatments for cancer patients.

But now we face a serious financial crisis. Without your help, WAMM could lose our home and no longer be here for those most in need.

So please read on to learn more about WAMM, and discover all the fun, engaging ways you can help us bring healing, joy, community and cannabis to those in need.

What We Need & What You Get

In this initial round of fundraising, WAMM is hoping to raise $150,000, which will help us make significant progress towards staying on the land while continuing to service low-income patients on a sliding scale.

In appreciation for your generous donation, we're offering everything from a personalized email with photos and a special message of thanks from a seriously ill WAMM member you've helped, to artwork made by WAMM members, and even (for qualified California patients only) a special medical marijuana infused meal prepared by my 92-year-old mother, the famed "Queen of Weed Cuisine" Nonna Marijuana!


Note: It is possible to make a tax-deductible donation to WAMM via check, please contact wammvideo@gmail.com with inquiries.

    The Impact

    Your donation will directly support our efforts to keep WAMM going and provide a supportive community that truly represents the compassionate roots of the medical marijuana movement.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    A small donation of $5 or $10 will help a lot, but even if you're not able to make a direct financial contribution to WAMM at this time, please consider supporting us by telling your friends and family, and getting the word out on social media. Use the tools provided by Indiegogo or just post to your own accounts.

story:
The Issue: India's water, sanitation, & hygiene crisis is the largest public health problem in the world. 700 million people don't have toilets, clean drinking water, safe menstrual hygiene management, or hand hygiene.

  • Only 32% of rural Indian households and less than half of all Indian households have a toilet at home. There are more households with a mobile phone than with a toilet.
  • Only 53% of the population in India wash hands with soap after defecation, 38% before eating, and only 30% before preparing food.
  • 1,000 children die daily due to diarrhea in India.
  • Children weakened by frequent diarrhea episodes are more vulnerable to malnutrition, stunting, and opportunistic infections such as pneumonia. About 48% (almost half) of all children in India are suffering from some degree of malnutrition. Diarrhea and worm infection are two major health conditions that affect school age children impacting their learning abilities.

Background: Narikuravar is an indigenous community from the Indian state of Tamil Nadu. Traditionally a nomadic people (Narikuravar meaning similar to “gypsy” in English), the main occupation of the people is hunting. However, they have been prohibited entry into the forests to pursue this livelihood and were forced to take up other alternatives such as selling beaded ornaments to survive. Because of this oppression, the Narikuravar people are unable to improve their current situation or increase their livelihood.

The major issues confronting the Narikuravas people are poverty, illiteracy, disease, and discrimination. The Narikuravar people are often classified as a depressed class, some say even beneath the Dalits (or the “untouchables”) on the caste system. This population has endured mass discrimination throughout history and still today, forcing the people to live hand-to-mouth, scavenging for food, without even the most basic amenities. The programs proposed below will help to alleviate the prevalence of disease in the area and improve the community’s overall livelihood. 

                                          

                                 

Present Situation: One group of Narikuravar migrated and settled down at Dharapuram. This community sells beads and hunt birds, uses makeshift huts for dwellings, and has no basic sanitation facilities. Men, women, and children bathe and defecate in the open. The community only has access to clean water (provided by the local government) for an hour a day. While there will soon be a communal bathhouse and larger storage tank to hold more water, under these present conditions, this community is being denied access to good health, appropriate hygiene, and a sufficient livelihood.

“80% of diseases are caused by unsafe water and lack of basic sanitation…and kill more people every year than all forms of violence, including war” - Charity:Water.org

Plan of Action: A Health & Hygiene Campaign will be implemented for all villagers as well as a Soap Making, Using, and Selling Tutorial for 10 village women. The Health & Hygiene Campaign will cover basic disease prevention as well has proper health, hygiene, and hand washing practices and will be taught in the 2 local primary schools and to the larger community. Supplies will be provided to build 3 separate hand washing stations, 2 at the larger school and 1 at the smaller. The same campaign along with a tutorial on Soap Making, Using, and Selling (including information on small business development topics including pricing, accounting, and marketing) will be taught to the villagers of Narikuravar. Complete soap making supplies will be provided to 10 village women.

Impact: The objectives of this project will be to mitigate health concerns and provide an alternative source of livelihood amongst the Narikuravar community by educating them on best hygiene practices and teaching them how to make, use, and sell soap. The purpose of the outlined objectives is to create a sustainably healthier people and community, and to empower and help improve the community’s livelihood by introducing new entrepreneurship opportunities. The program used to implement these objectives will utilize the local resources available in order ensure a sustainable impact. The amount of funding needed to successfully fulfill the proposal's goals is $3,000.

“Washing hands with soap and water could reduce diarrheal disease and death by up to 50%” –CDC Guidelines for less developed countries.

                                      

About the Author: I am a graduate social work student completing my last collegiate internship with CASA in Chennai, India. This opportunity will allow me to utilize the skills I have earned during my studies while also fulfilling my passion to make a real difference in the lives of oppressed and marginalized people around the world.

More About The Agency:

Church’s Auxiliary for Social Action (CASA) was founded in 1947 to initially provide immediate relief to victims of natural disasters but has now expanded to being a top development organization. CASA's programmatic interventions consist of humanitarian aid, gender equality, and initiatives to address structural poverty. The organization seeks to improve the lives for the poor, women, marginalized, and underprivileged communities they serve

story:
Your contribution to We Speak isn't just a contribution. It's your commitment to creating real change in fashion advertising - for your daughters and women everywhere.

You read the articles about eating disorders, young women being financially and sexually exploited, stick-thin models being told they are fat (by the very agencies who represent them!), "plus-sized" models being both attacked and supported.

You "like" the positive messages, you comment, you share, you sigh, and sometimes cry. Then you move on to the next post, the next email, the next text message.

You aren't indifferent, heartless, or uncaring. You want to see things change.

You want advertising to represent you and those close to you. You want healthy images in the media to inspire and influence the next generation. You want to know that high end advertisment in the glossy magazine didn’t come at the expense of a young woman’s dignity.

You've just never been given the opportunity to take real action to make a real difference.

We Speak is designed to empower and protect models, give designers and consumers a choice to make a difference, plus create an advertising culture we can be proud to have the next generation look up to.

The We Speak Revolution.

What we are undertaking with We Speak has never been done before.

Let me repeat that - THIS HAS NEVER BEEN DONE BEFORE.

Never has there been an existing agency that can say:
  • We’re a positive body-image fashion revolution!
  • We advocate greater media representation for women who look like you.
  • We represent models who are health conscious and drug-free.
  • We look beyond size.
  • We protect our models from financial exploitation. 

(Sabina M. - above - is We Speak Health Approved!)


We know you’ve been waiting for an opportunity to make a difference. THIS IS IT.


There are just two things you need to do:

Contribute  

Every dollar matters. It’s easy to think, “someone else will do it.” We Speak needs to launch with funds from people (like you!) who want to make a difference. Choose a reward and contribution level you are comfortable with and commit. It’ll be easier than that first relationship you committed to!

Share  

The momentum of social media is vital to this revolution! Cats and laughing babies go viral. This message will do so much more than just make people smile! SHARE.

You'll know your dollars are working when you see our We Speak Seal of Pride in stores and campaigns. (It means they're hiring healthy models!)

.



Perks

100% Heavy Cotton TeeWho doesn't love stickers?

Help feed Shange! (Free range is pricey these days!)


How does We Speak Promote Healthy Living?

We encourage holistic health. Eating plenty of unprocessed whole foods and exercising is just a part of the equation. We also cultivate mental, social, familial, and financial wellness. Each of our models pass a comprehensive health questionnaire plus a doctor's physical before becoming We Speak Health Approved.


The Big Picture

$75,000

Here's where your money is going: 



$100,000 - $200,000

  • Let's aim higher! We really want to land an incredible partnership with select designers for a huge NYFW kickoff, and going even just a little bit over our "goal" will help us accomplish much more!

The Team

We Speak is made possible by:

Briauna Mariah, CEO & Founder of We Speak

Briauna graduated high school with her Associates degree: a triple graduation. She has been modeling professionally since 2008, has co-hosted a fashion show benefitting Susan G. Komen 3 Day; walked in MBFW; been featured in hair trends, magazines, lookbooks, editorials; and more. Briauna wants everyone to have the confidence to feel beautiful in the body they were born with. She is applying her knowledge of people, industry, technology, and business to change the world. 

Jaison Greene, Certified Holistic Health Coach
Jaison Greene has over 10 years of training and direct personal experience helping people safely and successfully complete their first internal cleanse.  He’s been a featured contributor on Livestrong.com, MomsLoveIt.com and the author of  several definitive articles and white papers on basic cleansing and nutrition, as well as more advanced forms of detoxification.

Deleyna Marr, Web Developer
Deleyna has been a consultant to clients ranging from the Boise, ID Water District to NASA Life Sciences for the shuttle program. She has provided technical support to a nation-wide network of chiropractors and has programmed in Fortran, Java, and assorted web languages. She enjoys "helping computers and people learn to live together and play nice."

Also, a special thanks goes out to: Anna Kruyer & her mom, Annabella Difrancesco, Sarah Evans, Katherine Antiquera, Janel Koloski, Chelsea LeSage, Emilie Paap, Freia Titland, Sabina McKenna, Manish Dahiya, Zac Sax, John Carluccio, and YOU and everyone else, for believing in our mission!

Want to get even more involved?

Get social! Snap a photo wearing our swag, add #WeSpeak on Instagram, Twitter and/or Facebook, and your photo may end up in our updates!
story_txt:
Your contribution to We Speak isn't just a contribution. It's your commitment to creating real change in fashion advertising - for your daughters and women everywhere.

You read the articles about eating disorders, young women being financially and sexually exploited, stick-thin models being told they are fat (by the very agencies who represent them!), "plus-sized" models being both attacked and supported.
You "like" the positive messages, you comment, you share, you sigh, and sometimes cry. Then you move on to the next post, the next email, the next text message.

You aren't indifferent, heartless, or uncaring. You want to see things change.


You want advertising to represent you and those close to you. You want healthy images in the media to inspire and influence the next generation. You want to know that high end advertisment in the glossy magazine didn’t come at the expense of a young woman’s dignity.
You've just never been given the opportunity to take real action to make a real difference.
We Speak is designed to empower and protect models, give designers and consumers a choice to make a difference, plus create an advertising culture we can be proud to have the next generation look up to.

The We Speak Revolution.


What we are undertaking with We Speak has never been done before.
Let me repeat that - THIS HAS NEVER BEEN DONE BEFORE.Never has there been an existing agency that can say:

We’re a positive body-image fashion revolution!
We advocate greater media representation for women who look like you.
We represent models who are health conscious and drug-free.
We look beyond size.
We protect our models from financial exploitation. 









(Sabina M. - above - is We Speak Health Approved!)


We know you’ve been waiting for an opportunity to make a difference. THIS IS IT.

There are just two things you need to do:

Contribute  


Every dollar matters. It’s easy to think, “someone else will do it.” We Speak needs to launch with funds from people (like you!) who want to make a difference. Choose a reward and contribution level you are comfortable with and commit. It’ll be easier than that first relationship you committed to!


Share  
The momentum of social media is vital to this revolution! Cats and laughing babies go viral. This message will do so much more than just make people smile! SHARE.


You'll know your dollars are working when you see our We Speak Seal of Pride in stores and campaigns. (It means they're hiring healthy models!)


.

Perks

100% Heavy Cotton TeeWho doesn't love stickers?
Help feed Shange! (Free range is pricey these days!)

   
How does We Speak Promote Healthy Living?
We encourage holistic health. Eating plenty of unprocessed whole foods and exercising is just a part of the equation. We also cultivate mental, social, familial, and financial wellness. Each of our models pass a comprehensive health questionnaire plus a doctor's physical before becoming We Speak Health Approved.

The Big Picture
$75,000
Here's where your money is going: 




$100,000 - $200,000
Let's aim higher! We really want to land an incredible partnership with select designers for a huge NYFW kickoff, and going even just a little bit over our "goal" will help us accomplish much more!

    

The Team

We Speak is made possible by:
Briauna Mariah, CEO & Founder of We Speak
Briauna graduated high school with her Associates degree: a triple graduation. She has been modeling professionally since 2008, has co-hosted a fashion show benefitting Susan G. Deleyna Marr, Web Developer Deleyna has been a consultant to clients ranging from the Boise, ID Water District to NASA Life Sciences for the shuttle program. She has provided technical support to a nation-wide network of chiropractors and has programmed in Fortran, Java, and assorted web languages. story:
Why Mental Health?....Because UMATTER

There is not one person who has not been impacted by mental health challenges, directly or indirectly. It does not matter if you are rich or poor; black, white, red, yellow, or brown, mental health affects us all. Just read the headlines...from over 900 deaths from mass shootings in the last 7 years to an  alarming number of suicides by celebrities and popular religious leaders including Robin Williams, Don Cornelius, Lee Thompson Young, and Pastor Teddy Parker. These are only a few names that have made national news. Think about the countless number of people who we know and love that suffer from mental health challenges but never make the headlines.

You or a loved one may have experienced overwhelming stress, anxiety, depression, or a more serious mental health issue. I am Dr. Sherry and like many of you, I grew up in a community where mental health was and still is a topic that you do not dare talk about openly. People tend to ignore mental health problems because they are often embarrassed or ashamed to deal with them.  

UMATTER Campaign

Stigma is the number one reason why many people, especially African Americans, do not talk about mental health challenges or seek help. It is time to change that! Stigma is something that can be changed because it all starts in the mind. The Edge Empowerment Foundation and myself are excited to launch UMATTER, a national campaign to reduce mental health stigma and increase awareness while promoting mental health wellness. UMATTER (Understanding Mental Health Awareness Through Technology, Education, and Research) is an innovative program where you can interact and hear celebrities share their stories about mental health challenges as well as enjoy music and other forms of entertainment. Multiple events are planned that will be exciting, interactive, informative, and empowering.

The Need

The need for UMATTER is great! Stigma is embedded and perpetuated through family and friends, churches and other faith based communities, cultural stereotypes, and media reports. We are our brother's keeper and it is our goal to reduce the stigma of mental health by creating platforms for everyday people. Combating mental health stigma is our number one priority. We need your help in donations, sponsorships, and in-kind services. Join us and make a difference in someone's life.

Testimonial........

I was diagnosed with Kidney Cancer in 2013, and I went through the process as if it was a piece of cake. Never realizing that my entire life was altered with one diagnosis. I went through a Radical Nephrectomy losing my left kidney. Openly, I wore a mask pretending that life was amazing and secretly, I was a wreck, lost for words and I didn't know how to feel and I did not have anyone to express my feelings to. I was spiraling downward and I was literally depressed. I started seeing Dr. Sherry and I found a safe haven, I was able to say the things to her that I could not say to anyone else. I found myself getting stronger; I could say the word cancer without wanting to jump off a cliff. She took me through the process of healing step by step, she never judged me, and she willed me back. It is because of her, I am back and now preparing to speak to those worldwide about life after kidney cancer. All I can say is she is the best thing that has ever happened to me………

Signed

Victor Living through Cancer!!!!


What We Need & What You Get

Dr. Sherry and the Edge Empowerment Foundation's goal is to raise $100,000 to officially launch the UMATTER campaign and events. UMATTER is not just a campaign, it's a movement! We need your help now! Please join the movement and help us by giving donations, sponsorships, and in-kind services. By giving to this cause, you will be helping change lives.

When you donate….

$25 or more you will receive a personal shout out from Dr. Sherry on your social media.

$50 or more you will also receive an "I Am Change UMATTER" tee shirt.

$100 or more you will also receive an autographed copy of Dr. Sherry’s book "The Single-Married Woman".

$1000 or more you will also receive a free 45 minute session with Dr. Sherry.

$5000 or more you will also receive 2 tickets to a UMATTER event and special recognition.

$10,000 or more you will also receive 5 tickets to a UMATTER event with VIP access and special print recognition. 

* UMATTER is a part of the Edge Empowerment Foundation, a nonprofit organization. All donations are tax deductible and are used to help achieve our mission.


The Impact

UMATTER will impact the lives of individuals, families, and communities tremendously. We need your help in making mental health and mental wellness common household words. We must remove the stigma in order for this to happen. We know that if we Educate Locally, we will Impact Globally! Please join us in making a difference!

Risks & Challenges

There are no risks or challenges associated with the UMATTER campaign. Our mission of reducing mental health stigma and increasing mental health awareness while promoting mental health wellness will be achieved with you help.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone may not be able to contribute financially. However, everyone can still be a part of the UMATTER Campaign. Volunteering your time or even spreading the word on social media is needed and greatly appreciated! Please visit us at www.edgeempowerment.com to find more ways that you can get involved and make a difference.

story:
We intend to send five (5) hospital beds to the most isolated municipal health center in the Republic of the Philippines: Pag-asa Island, Municipality of Kalayaan, Palawan. Otherwise known as the "Spratly Islands".

The facility caters to the health needs of the 200+ civilian and military residents of the island, and is staffed by a team of 10 nurses and health workers who take turns being deployed to the island.

The basic structure for the center was built in 2013, with work on internal finishings completed in 2014. For 2015, the municipality is working to equip the facility. The #pagasaKIG FB group intends to make support for that effort a major focal point for this year's activities.

The beds we are donating are manually operated, three-crank hospitals beds. These low-tech beds are not only affordable and not dependent on electrical power -- which is unreliable on the island -- they are also easier to maintain than electric hospital beds (which may become the object of a future project). Because of the challenge of getting to the islands, which can only be reached reliably from sea between April and May of each year, the beds must not require support by specially trained technical support personnel to keep operational.

The group behind this effort, #pagasaKIG, is an international community of Filipinos and Filipino-migrants that has been organizing donation projects for Philippine beneficiaries since 2006, and has been sending items to Kalayaan since 2012. More details about the group, and it's other projects for the municipality and beyond are available here:

https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=oa.887455317965748&type=1

Photos of our supply runs to the Ayungin reef detachment available here:

https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=oa.887478391296774&type=1

story:
All Life Therapy Center         

We need your help!  


         We'd like to open the gates this year.  Can you be a part of it, can you make it happen with us? YES!


We want to open a Therapy Center in Hua Hin, Thailand.  Everyone will be welcome. A place where people (and animals) can find professional help.


We are trying to crowd fund 229'000 USD. It is possible if everybody just gives a little. 


What's the plan?     We want to offer help.

Anyone can change and start a new life. Sometimes all it takes is a helping hand...

        

                                                                                                        ...to make you smile again!   

What the Center will be:  It will be the first Therapy Center in Hua Hin, Thailand. We will offer a variety of professional help. We want to help you change and have a better quality of life, because it's your life. Too many things can stand in our way to live a life of freedom. 

Whether it's depression or fear, post traumatic disorder, stress, borderline syndrome, anxiety, addiction, abuse, neglect or so much more. 

We just simply need renewal and healing in our lives, don't we? 

But how?

Let  "All Life Therapy Center"  be the place you come to and find healing and restoration. We need your help to complete this vision.  Let me show you how:


                                                                              

What I do

So far, I have had a amazing career as a professional therapist and life coach (helped more than a 1000 People in the past 23 years) and I am ready to use my knowledge and skills in Hua Hin, Thailand. 

Presently, I work in Switzerland in a Institution with mentally challenged people as well as in my private practice with anyone who desires help.

I've trained and lectured many years  on various psychological topics at conferences and workshops or individual trainings. 


Animal Therapy

Additionally I treat traumatized  animals as well, that's why we call it     

"All Life Therapy Center". Animals are  one of my greatest passions.  

Check our Website below or follow us on Facebook and see many examples.

   

     


What are we doing?  We want to open the gates to "All Life Therapy Center" in Hua Hin as soon as we can. We, my son (7) and I, have decided to completey change the course of our lives, dedicating ourselves to the people and animals in Hua Hin, Thailand.  We've spent many months in Hua Hin and  realized that there is a need for a Center like that. By sharing our vision and talking to many people there, we are convinced that this is the place we need to be.  There is nothing there like it so far. People travel up to 3 hours to find therapy.  

Also we would be able to improve many lives of traumatized animals. We've seen what a large amount of work that is.  We can only do it with your help and support. 

Hua Hin Animal Care    Link to our Website

Our Facebook Site with Infos and pictures    Link to Facebook (please click and send a friend request) 


The next step

We found the perfect house!   We have an accepted offer on it and your contribution will help us bring the center to life.          

    


You will help us secure the property and make the required improvements. Then we can  start helping people and saving the lives of the countless animals that desperately need us.  You'll help us build a place you can visit as well (contribute  your gifts - anything really).

Your contribution will help us create a place where we can offer various types of help. Therapy session indoors or outdoors, group sessions, workshops and  effective animal care. It will be unlike any center you've seen before.  It's a huge task, I know.  But if anyone can do it, we can.  

The center used to be a dream but it is so much more than that now.  It has become a mission and I will move heaven and earth to make it happen. 


LIFE  All Life Therapy Center will be a place where you can find:


  • Psychological, therapeutic, emotional help as well as counseling and mentoring. 

  • One time session or longer therapy 
  • Group therapy   (special needs)


  • We treat traumatized animals as well.  (visit my Animal care site below and see what has been done so far)
  •       

  •        

Animals need our help   Please click on this link to see our Animal rescue Site

  • Life coaching


    My book  "Rejection Overruled" could help you become what you were meant to be:  "Free and happy"!

       


  • Understanding, encouragement and hope

      


The Campaign  for the Therapy Center

We need to raise a minimum of 229'000 US Dollars.   Yes, I know that is a lot. And that is why we cannot do it alone. We need your help. If everyone gives a little, we can make it!


This is basically "start up money" to enable us to realize the project.  

( 7.5 M Baht or  200'000 Euro,  or  218'000 Swiss Franks) 

 
Be it $1 or $100,000, every penny gets us closer to our goal but it's not just money, we need to spread the word far and wide. Any ideas?



In more detail, the funds are needed for:


  • The House payment,  including the land  600 square meters
  • Lawyers fee's  and papers
  • Adjustments, renovations for the house. (Electricity, kitchen, furniture, outside renovations, garden, office)



  • And additionally we will also need to provide for:  


  • Visas and working permit cost

  • Travel costs                               and office supplies  

                           

  • Animal cages for transport  (medical care) and medical supplies

     

  •  Possibly some kind of vehicle


    Some voices from Hua Hin:

    -  I.K:    excellent idea. I often think of turning to any depressants as there is nowhere here who can help in our darkest hours I will certainly use your centre for myself!

    - K.G:    YES!!   Especially with some of our broken ladies in Thailand, whose parents sold them, etc.    Many of our ladies have very very low self-worth...because of what happened to them and how Thai men treat women - not all Thai men.  I am SO GRATEFUL you are doing this.

    - A.A:    It's wonderful to have a place where those in need of mental health care will be taking care of...praying here for the soon opening success of this poject of yours your project will benefit a lot of people in Hua Hin.

    - H.T.  Hi Natalie! I'm really happy that you have that big concern for people and animals here in huahin. I just looked at your website and it's really an excellent way to help abused animals.

    - M.J.     thank you .  I am diffinately want to supprt this wonderful project.

    - M.M.   hi it is one of the brilliant ideas and i really support from my side ... it will be helpful in Asian countries if u start your therapy in Thailand . so yes from my side. let me know more from you which i can help you



    TOGETHER WE CAN DO ANYTHING                    BECAUSE:

                   

  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Let the word out and make some noise about our campaign, specifically using the Indiegogo share tools. The short code for our campaign is  http://igg.me/at/AllLife
  • Can you be a Team Member and share your valuable advice in the process?
  • Can you help us with the electric, painting, garden, furnishing?
  • Can you help us with cleaning or moving?
  • There will be many ways to help the project, get your own inspiration  :)


  • I have more questions. Who do I ask?

    We love to hear from you. Simply shoot us an email to  

    all.life.therapy.center [at] gmail.com and we will get back to you quickly.


    Our Team Members      LIFE   All Life Therapy Center


    Natalie Stangl         -Founder

    Kaylian Stangl        - Animal lover and heart motivator

    Tatiana Zubajova  - Editor and Animal advisor

    Niki Zubajova         -  Thai translator and Animal care

    Sabrina June          -  General Advisor

    Andreas Stangl           -   Financial Advisor

    Tina Brea                      -   Website Editor support

    Sylvia Guerra              -   Marketing, Insurance Agent

What are we doing?  We want to open the gates to "All Life Therapy Center" in Hua Hin as soon as we can. We, my son (7) and I, have decided to completey change the course of our lives, dedicating ourselves to the people and animals in Hua Hin, Thailand.  We've spent many months in Hua Hin and  realized that there is a need for a Center like that. By sharing our vision and talking to many people there, we are convinced that this is the place we need to be.  There is nothing there like it so far. People travel up to 3 hours to find therapy.  


Also we would be able to improve many lives of traumatized animals. We've seen what a large amount of work that is.  We can only do it with your help and support. 


Hua Hin Animal Care    Link to our Website


Our Facebook Site with Infos and pictures    Link to Facebook (please click and send a friend request) 


The next step
We found the perfect house!   We have an accepted offer on it and your contribution will help us bring the center to life.          
    


You will help us secure the property and make the required improvements. Then we can  start helping people and saving the lives of the countless animals that desperately need us.  You'll help us build a place you can visit as well (contribute  your gifts - anything really).


Your contribution will help us create a place where we can offer various types of help. Therapy session indoors or outdoors, group sessions, workshops and  effective animal care. It will be unlike any center you've seen before.  It's a huge task, I know.  But if anyone can do it, we can.  


The center used to be a dream but it is so much more than that now.  It has become a mission and I will move heaven and earth to make it happen. 


LIFE  All Life Therapy Center will be a place where you can find:


Psychological, therapeutic, emotional help as well as counseling and mentoring. 




One time session or longer therapy 

Group therapy   (special needs)




We treat traumatized animals as well.  (visit my Animal care site below and see what has been done so far)

      



       


Animals need our help   Please click on this link to see our Animal rescue Site


Life coaching

My book  "Rejection Overruled" could help you become what you were meant to be:  "Free and happy"!
   



Understanding, encouragement and hope  
   The Campaign  for the Therapy Center
We need to raise a minimum of 229'000 US Dollars.   Yes, I know that is a lot. And that is why we cannot do it alone. We need your help. If everyone gives a little, we can make it!

This is basically "start up money" to enable us to realize the project.  
( 7.5 M Baht or  200'000 Euro,  or  218'000 Swiss Franks) 

 Be it $1 or $100,000, every penny gets us closer to our goal but it's not just money, we need to spread the word far and wide. Any ideas?





In more detail, the funds are needed for:

The House payment,  including the land  600 square meters
Lawyers fee's  and papers
Adjustments, renovations for the house. (Electricity, kitchen, furniture, outside renovations, garden, office)













And additionally we will also need to provide for:  


Visas and working permit cost

Travel costs                               and office supplies                         


Animal cages for transport  (medical care) and medical supplies
 

 Possibly some kind of vehicle


Some voices from Hua Hin:
-  I.K:    excellent idea. I often think of turning to any depressants as there is nowhere here who can help in our darkest hours I will certainly use your centre for myself!
- K.G:    YES!!   Especially with some of our broken ladies in Thailand, whose parents sold them, etc.    Many of our ladies have very very low self-worth...because of what happened to them and how Thai men treat women - not all Thai men.  I am SO GRATEFUL you are doing this.
- A.A:    It's wonderful to have a place where those in need of mental health care will be taking care of...praying here for the soon opening success of this poject of yours your project will benefit a lot of people in Hua Hin.
- H.T.  Hi Natalie! I'm really happy that you have that big concern for people and animals here in huahin. I just looked at your website and it's really an excellent way to help abused animals.
- M.J.     thank you .  I am diffinately want to supprt this wonderful project.
- M.M.   hi it is one of the brilliant ideas and i really support from my side ... it will be helpful in Asian countries if u start your therapy in Thailand . so yes from my side.  let me know more from you which i can help you


TOGETHER WE CAN DO ANYTHING                    BECAUSE:


                       Other Ways You Can Help Some of you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  Let the word out and make some noise about our campaign, specifically using the Indiegogo share tools. The short code for our campaign is  http://igg.me/at/AllLife

Can you be a Team Member and share your valuable advice in the process?
Can you help us with the electric, painting, garden, furnishing?
Can you help us with cleaning or moving?
There will be many ways to help the project, get your own inspiration  :)






I have more questions. Who do I ask?
We love to hear from you. Simply shoot us an email to  
all.life.therapy.center [at] gmail.com and we will get back to you quickly.


Our Team Members      LIFE   All Life Therapy Center

Natalie Stangl         -Founder
Kaylian Stangl        - Animal lover and heart motivator
Tatiana Zubajova  - Editor and Animal advisor
Niki Zubajova         -  Thai translator and Animal care
Sabrina June          -  General Advisor
Andreas Stangl           -   Financial Advisor
Tina Brea                      -   Website Editor support
Sylvia Guerra              -   Marketing, Insurance Agent

story:
Introduction

Hello everyone! My name's Auston Bilbrey, I'm 18 years old and I'm from the United States. I'm a very athletic person, and love sports. 3 years ago I visited Sri Lanka for the first time. I instantly fell in love with the place and with the people. This past year I was able to go back, and an opportunity opened up for me to play soccer. I'm planning on going back in July though October. This upcoming trip is the ability for me to do mission work in Sri Lanka in the way I know best. Soccer. There are many organizations that do mission work through soccer, but there is no one reaching out to those in this country. Your contribution would help me live my dream, and help put a smile on a kids face. 

Why do you need so much? 

I know. $2500 looks like A LOT. It is. However my last trips plane ticket was a lot more than that! I believe with your help we can do this. $1743.70 is the current plane cost. The cost of living there is not much, and I've planned out $5 a day. That adds up to $2193.70 Now you may be asking, what about the extra $303.30? My plan is to use that for supplies, and as an emergency fund. It is also in case the ticket price goes up. 

Perks

Hey! We all like perks! I've come up with a few, and I'm always thinking of more! 

  • The day $5
        This one's pretty obvious. I'm planning on a 5$ day expense. Donate $5 and I'll send you an email, or Facebook Message, or however message you want to tell you about my day that day AND how I spent your $5! 
  • The Retrospective $10
       The Retrospective is all about my last trip. For $10 I will send you a copy of my day journal! I was there from July to December, you pick a day, and I'll send you what I did! If of course I didn't write that day I will send you the closest one. 
  • The Pics $15
        Donate $15 and I will send you all of my pictures from my last trip, as well as pictures from this trip.
  • The Giver $20
         Donate $20 and I will buy a soccer ball and give it to a kid, in your name. 
  • The Updates $50
        Donate $50 and I will send you personalized updates each week! 
  • The What's In It For Me? $100
         Donate $100 and I will send you a souvenir from Sri Lanka! 
  • The Hear ALL about it $500
         Donate $500 and I will spend an entire day with you (or Skype/phone call) you to tell you every detail of the trip. 
  • The Plane $1743.70
         I'm a plane. I cost $1743.70

The Impact

Your donation, no matter how large, or how little, will make an impact in the life of a child. Whether it's the joy of playing soccer with a white kid, or the valuable things I teach, you will make a difference. In my last trips, I felt famous. I was the only white person for MILES around. I would make children giggle just by walking by. And when I spoke their language, it was even funnier. This is something every child would tell their parents. These children will go home and say, "Mommy! Daddy! I played with a white kid!" I represent you. I represent the United States. I represent white people. I won't let you down. I feel for these kids. They are my friends. I love them all. 

Risks & Challenges

There will of course be risks. And challenges. The first challenge is of course food. Nothing but rice and curry as far as the eye can see. However your $5 donation will help that, I also plan on packing food, and enjoying the time I have. Another risk is of course injury. In case of an injury that extra money could come in a lot of handy, and I trust the medical staff. I caught a really weird thing called Viral Fever last time. I went to the doctor, and got some medicine, and of course it helped! It was only $6 as well! 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you don't have the money, there are still many ways to help. Encouraging words mean A LOT to me, and keep me going. You also can share this with everyone you know! You never know who will be able to help make an impact! 

There are plenty of soccer organizations as well you can donate to, such as One World Futbol. They give indestructible soccer balls to places that really need them. Having lost balls to the terrain of Sri Lanka, I'm planning on bringing one of these, even though they have no relation to me.

story:
We started our company 9 years ago and it really started to take flight a few years ago. We hand craft Hickory Lacrosse shafts for the game of Lacrosse and ship around the world!

In 2013 we started attending Lacrosse tournaments to get our shafts out to more youth games. Our goals are twofold: One, we want to help combat childhood obesity by supporting kids from any background to learn a very cool game that is increasing rapidly in popularity. Second, to educate about the benefits of using wood Lacrosse sticks vs the very expensive lightweight shafts. Our hope is that parents don't have to spend a lot of money to find out if their kid really loves the game AND for kids that may not be able to afford that Titanium shaft to get the chance to learn the game with the perfection of a hand made wooden shaft.

Please help us with our efforts to raise money for a good cause so that we can promote & market our business and develop our 5 acres into Lacrosse fields to hold tournaments and clinics for youth ages 8-18.

story:
Misty Artesian Water Summary

Misty Artesian Water is pure water filtered through Kentucky’s world famous limestone. Safeguarded in deep natural caverns, far below the earth’s surface. The unique thing about this water is not just the quality of the water but yet the bottle that it is fostered in an patented awareness ribbon shaped bottle and tinted pink to represent breast cancer awareness. This product was birthed from an idea by the founder of the company Misty Washington after losing loved ones to their battle with breast cancer. The idea of what if there was a unique “feel good” product that represented awareness, which many would be motivated to utilize and carry around, was created. Her goal with the product was to make it successful enough to generate revenue to drive support for these causes. The vision of a unique product to support the awareness of many causes was then conceptualized into the creation of the Misty Bottle of awareness. The product was then designed, patented, manufactured, and tested with great response of the beauty as well as the taste.

We believe our campaign is extremely important because we are on the brink of building a very successful company that will drive a great deal of financial support to many non-profit and charitable organizations. We have invested a lot of money into the creation and initial production of the product. It is so important that we raise enough money to complete our journey and make this a stable company that can continue to grow from the initial success and sell many awareness products, and in turn, donate a portion of the proceeds to these impactful organizations.

The Impact

With the Misty Bottle of Awareness we can create an impactful company. This product can be in every major retailer nationwide as well as support events created to bring awareness to the causes. There are many walks, marathons, and activities that people participate in to help drive and support awareness, with Misty Artesian water we will help spread that awareness while hydrating supporters. With your contribution we will be able to ensure that our bottle of awareness for breast cancer will be able to continue on a path of success and support. With your contribution to our campaign, you will receive product in return, with the only expectation of our $5 founders perk.

What We Need & What You Get

We are in need of funds to finish current production and begun new mass production. Currently we have over 40,000 bottles in stock that need to be filled with our Artesian Water.

With our goal of $15,000 we will be able to fill the bottles we currently have; with extra funds from this campaign we will be able to meet the minimum quantity on new orders, lowering production cost per bottle.

In order to complete the foundation of building this company we need your help. Your help will allow us to build a stable company which then positions us to sell products that benefit this impactful cause and then be able to grow to support many other causes and charitable organizations.

If we do not reach our goal with this campaign, it does not hinder us from being able to fulfill your perk orders.

The Perks (All Perks include shipping)


Risks & Challenges

The faster we meet our goal and beyond, the faster orders will be able to be processed, therefore fulfillment can be processed not only on time but possibly earlier. The risk we may face is a slower campaign, which may result in a slight shipping delay.

In the event of a slow campaign, to avoid delays, we will adjust our strategy to get the fulfillment process completed earlier.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not able to pledge we invite all support and help to get the word out. Please share with your family and friends. Be sure to visit our Facebook page and share as well as utilize indiegogo share features.

story:
My name is Cole Smith. I am 23 years old, and through the help of my father we have developed a product that is going to create a healthier living environment.

Throughout my life I have suffered with chronic lung issues, which pushed me to develop this product. I have recently became engaged, to a beautiful young woman, we are planning on getting married in September, and plan to build a house shortly after; This is my primary drive in life; to get this product off the ground and in the air.

My goal is to help others who are concerned with the quality of air in their living environment. With this product, you can be confident your air that is coming from your central air conditioning system is, in fact, clean.

The Ultra V-LED is a small generator driven from the air flow, from your central air conditioning system, which powers a UV/LED light probe within your duct system. This is a green, self-powered product which requires no batteries. This is designed to eliminate germs, neutralize odors, air pollutants, mold, bacteria and viruses. It is easily mounted on the grill of your HVAC system. It can be placed on all of your supply outlets in either your home or business.

We are also developing other versions, one of which will monitor temperatures that exits each vent, and displays it digitally. Another version which has a simple attachment that delivers fragrances of your choice, throughout your house or business.


Our campaign goal is to raise enough money to be able to produce prototypes. We need to seek out manufacturing in order to pursue our first production run.

Please help my team and I with this endeavor. We hope to help everyone live in a cleaner and safer environment.


Please spread the word and share our amazing product!

http://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/be3e0057

story:
Nepal was hit by a huge 7.8 magnitude earthquake and several huge aftershocks. The destruction and loss are heartbreaking! The buildings are fragile! The loss is unimaginable! Millions of people are left homeless - without food and water!

The suffering is more than you can imagine!

We have been personally affected by this tragedy and have many family members in Nepal. 

As you know, Nepal is one of the poorest countries in the world, and it is struggling to recover from the devastating natural disaster.

Please help fund Manakamana Foundation to help the victims of earthquake in Nepal.

How will the money be used? 

EVERY penny and dollar will be used for direct support (food, water, medical supplies, shelter needs, freight cost, etc.).  The fund will be used in conjunction with other non-profit organizations. We are constantly communicating with direct contacts in Nepal to understand the immediate needs. This way, can we respond quickly to meet the needs of the Nepalese people within a few days.  In most cases money goes directly to on-site medical and rescue workers, so they can directly purchase and distribute supplies.

Who are we? 

We are a group of Nepalese living in the USA. We are deeply hurt that our native country is screaming for help, and people are crying in pain.  We are motivated and driven to help our fellow Nepalese.  We have direct connections in Nepal to help ensure your donations will be used to make a positive impact. 

If you have questions, we will be more than happy to answer them.

Please make a contribution. Every dollar counts!

Thank you and God bless.

Manakamana Foundation

info@manakamanafoundation.org

www.manakamanafoundation.org

https://www.facebook.com/ManakamanaFoundation

story:
Language / Idioma / Langue / Sprache / Lingua.

(...Some translations coming soon)   

Don’t let them be alone

The smartest way to look after your loved ones at all times, and to be automatically informed if anything ever happens to them.

A wide range of ultra-modern wearables and software solutions designed to guarantee the safety of your people; Children, Grands, Dependents, Pets and also your most valuable stuff.

 

The Challenge

A Global Epidemic", Infographic World Alzheimer Reports

 

The Solution

A state-of-the-art way to combine top-notch technology with the smartest methodology to build today the wearables of tomorrow.

A security device that will alert you in real time that someone you love needs you. It’ll tell you the exact position of the incident so you may act before it’s too late.

Whether walking or in a vehicle, if you suffer an accident, don’t panic, we’ll know in real time where to find you.

And for the little ones… switch on the Water fall alarm and stop losing your nerves in swimming pools and beaches.

A pioneering vision with a global approach to create a real solution for the people who looks after other people.

 

 

With three independent localization systems (GPS, GSM & RADAR) and a Quad Band 2G module to guarantee connectivity wherever you are, you’ll be able to find everyone and everything you may be looking for in real time.

 

This technology together with the best and more advanced automated alert system, it will give you the peace of mind that you ever want it.

 

This is Pkids.

Simple?

Because the best security is the one you can’t see.

 

 

Different fears for different moments in life

 

Perfect for Summer or if you are close to water

Switch on the Water fall alarm and stop losing your nerves in swimming pools and beaches.

 

 

Whether walking or in a vehicle, if you suffer an accident, don’t panic, we’ll know in real time where to find you.

 

 

 

 

An eCall system is not a simple way to locate the people you care about, it is a system able to alert you in real-time if something happens to them.

Some of the possible alerts that you could configure are: In the coming days we’ll be adding a complete set of video tutorials about all these features. As an introduction to this guide, please find below the first video.

 

Multiple GEOFENCE Zone Configuration

A geofence is a is a feature in a software program that uses the GPS to define a geographical boundaries (a virtual perimeter).

There are many practical uses. For example, a user can set up alerts so when a child leaves the school grounds, the parents receive a notification with the exact location as long as with the option to switch on an active tracking over the child. Here is how to use the app to configure these zones:

 

 

The Bracelet in detail

 

Adjust your band with the different positions for three sizes.

  1. Slide the end of the strap through the Pkid.
  2. Insert the pin, and slide the end of the strap through the loop.
  3. Slide the loop toward the end of the strap.

 

 

 

 

 

Give your child the space and time to learn about freedom… without having to grant it yet!

 

 

PKIDs works without the need of Data Plans within a range of 60 meters thanks to its Bluetooth technology.

 

Do you need a bigger range? What about the whole world? Then, you need data.
Design your own plan from a single month up to 2 whole years.

NO BINDING FEES. PAY ONLY FOR WHAT YOU NEED

 

 

Plug & Play

How do I use my pKids

 

 

 

 

APP Compatibility

Multilingual

 

Requirements

iPhone® 4s/5/5c/5s/6/6 Plus
iPod® touch 5
iPad® 3/4/Air/mini
OS 7 & above
Android 4.3 and above

 

Why are we doing it?

The origins of the idea date back to March 2013 when my 3 years old son got lost for almost an hour in a mall close to our house.

After freaking out for several days, I was telling the story to a few friends, we all agree that it had to be something to avoid these situations. Some people however, claim that they didn’t want just another locator, they wanted a solution to help them to know when something was going wrong, an accident, a fall into the swimming pool… and also to allow their kids to tell them if they need help.

The problem was that there wasn’t anything like that, at least nothing wearable, lightweight, comfy and affordable.

So, that’s how we started.

After that, we realized that there’re a lot of people with similar problems, not only children, the population of elderly people is growing year after year, unfortunately many of them living alone (exposed to many potential risks), and an increasing percentage with some kind of dementia.

Of course, there are many other uses, pets, valuable stuff, bikes…

Javier, june 24th 2015
A worried dad (and a son!) looking for solutions

 

Our team

PlanetUs has brought together the best professionals in the field of consumer electronics, software development, industrial design and manufacturing.

On the other hand, the founders are professionals with a vast experience in finance, technology, health and marketing.

The four founders have been working together for the last 14 months on this project.

Michael and Javier worked together for +7 years on a different venture.

David and Javier have known each since the university days.

Last but not least, Nuria and Javier met at the primary school when they were about 4 years old. Since then, they have always been friends. However, their future friendship it may depends on the success of this project…

 

Risks, Challenges & Funds

When we first wrote down all the sophisticated features that we wanted to be part of our device, we felt the fear of not been able to accomplish our task, we got to understand what “risk” really means, however we accepted the challenge!

No doubt, it was risky designing a wearable so full of technical innovations and micro-sized electronics, something so new that there was no road map or blueprint for us to go off of

At that time we knew a few things about technology, apps and management but unfortunately we did not know much about crowdfunding… because of that, and because we really believed in our idea and the team behind it, we invested all our savings in developing the first and only eCall device for people.

Nowadays we have already finished and successfully tested all our devices, so we have got to reduce the many risks we started with, to almost just one, the minimum-order-quantity. This is why we need funding of no less than €30.000. Every additional cent it will allow us to scale down the manufacturing costs, and therefore it will contribute to the further development of amazing new features like:

 •     Medical measurements capabilities
 •     Reduce battery size while increasing its capacity and life
 •     Developing a full set of activity tracking features
 •     Introducing new materials (ie; Graphene)

Our biggest challenge is to build today the wearables of tomorrow, and make your world a safer place. With your help we can do it! 

We want you to be the first to get your hands on PKid and we want you to share your feedback and comments. This way, we will be able to finalize our first production.

We can't wait to see what we accomplish together.

Thank you for your support!

 

More than one device

Multiple designs for multiple uses, your people, your pet, your most valuable things… take control over your whole life from a single device.

 

 

Make your Business Stand Out

Part of a bigger group? Stand out from the crowd

Get as many bands as you need personalized with your own design, logo, colors…

If you are with a collective or association, PlanetUs give you peace of mind from the distance, being a unique value for:

 

Choose your perk:

 

AFTER YOUR SUPPORT

You will receive an email to get

6 ADDITIONAL MONTHS DATA FREE

 

 

Where is it working?

More than 200 countries without additional cost.

 

Please let us know if you have any questions, comments or suggestions!

You can leave your questions on the comments page or send us email to info@planetus.net
And please please please… don't forget to like and follow us on Facebook: to be up to date with the latest information!
Or send us a tweet: @Planetus_net @PlanetUsKids
For inquiries regarding Distribution, Retail, and Partnerships please email partner@planetus.net
If you are a mass media, please email press@planetus.net for more information.

story:
*Your support will help Courage Knoxville fund essential start-up operating expenses (i.e., web site costs, printed materials) that let the community know who we are and what we do!

Courage Knoxville empowers people with mood disorder & health resource information because mood molds quality living.

 Mood disorders (depression and bipolar disorders) affect nearly 1 in 10 Americans annually. Nearly 44 percent of people with mood disorder don't receive the treatment they need. This is unacceptable and dangerous. Courage Knoxville's mission is to empower people with mood disorder & mood health resource information because mood molds quality living. Our vision is people attaining, through empowerment, greater mood health in the face of mood disorders. This bold perspective can open up incredible opportunities for health outcomes and, thereby, Courage's view of human greatness: everyday people maximizing their individual and group potential, especially those who are marginalized. 


A Look Back

Courage Knoxville is a 501(c)(3) non-profit that is launching from Courage Long Island's (CLI) work in New York; together, Courage Knoxville and Courage Long Island form Courage Incorporated. Courage was founded in 2011, and its main work has been its Info Talks: one of our mental health professionals presents on mood disorders to an audience, a Q&A discussion is held, and audience members are provided with community resources. Our Info Talks have been done in schools to social service agencies to senior centers. Depression and bipolar disorder cut across demographic lines, so Courage seeks to work with all communities (i.e., communities of color, seniors, people with disABLITIES, the LGBTQ+ community, etc.).

Founder Andrew Calderaro was diagnosed with clinical depression at age 15, and he founded Courage in 2011. In 2014, he moved from New York to Knoxville to start his PhD, but he withdrew from the program because he felt his place was in the community. Knoxville is bustling with compassionate people, and there is much meaningful work to be done here. The time is to take what CLI contributed to mental health empowerment in New York and grow this mission here in Knoxville. 

Courage Knoxville will continue the organization's Info Talks educational outreach and grow into other services. Courage Knoxville looks forward to empowering Knoxvillians with mood health information so that they can live more balanced lives. #CourageForAll

Creating Courage

Getting started in a new city, Courage Knoxville needs seed funding to cover certain non-profit basics, specifically web site development and an in-person fundraiser (need money to raise money!). $1,000, a manageable goal, will help get these efforts off the ground. Take the next step with Courage Knoxville! 

What Can You Do with Courage (Knoxville)?

"I am cognizant of the interrelatedness of all communities and states...Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere. We are caught in an inescapable network of mutuality, tied in a single garment of destiny. Whatever affects one directly, affects all indirectly."

- Martin Luther King, Jr., Letter from a Birmingham Jail

Even if you don't like in Knoxville, your support bolsters mood health action and culture. 1 out of every 10 Americans experiences a mood disorder every year. The more people empower others, the more we create a positive, strengths-based culture and the more we can create greater mood health. Whether you care about the 200,000 people in Knoxville or care about mental health in your family or community, your contribution  moves mental health culture forward.

story:
To put it in perspective, just imagine waking up one day and looking at a reflection that did not match with your spirit.....not a reality most people would want to live (unless you're a masochist and you're into that kind of pain. lol). All jokes aside, transgender individuals face obstacles that make quality of life very poor. In my case, my trans status affects my career opportunities, love life, and psychological health.

Presenting myself as the woman I am inside has negatively impacted my chances of getting hired in the past because my drivers license, along with other government identification says that I am male, and in the state I live in order for me to change my gender mark to female, I would have to get the sex reassignment surgery. Although my gender mark should not be a determinant factor in making a decision to hire me or not, unfortunately we live in a society where people are ignorant and make unfair decisions based on a person's gender identity. I am a college student that comes from an immigrant background. My parents are not able to help me pay for my education, therefore, i have to take out student loans. If being transgender keeps affecting my career advancement, I will never be able to pay my student loan debt. 

Having the wrong junk also affects my love life. To me intimacy is a very important part of a loving relationship. I believe that in order for two people to be intimate with each other, each person needs to be intimate with his or herself first. I have a very hard time being intimate with myself because it is very hard to be intimate with a part of your body that you don't physically, spiritually or emotionally connect with.

Lastly, having the parts i have right now really impacts my psychological health. I have to tuck my privates with tape in order to go out in public every day. I cannot enjoy a family vacation to the beach because I cannot wear a bikini. I have to walk down the streets thinking about my tuck constantly because it can become untuck for everyone to notice, leaving me subject to potential transphobic people to hurt me. All these things plus much more I wont talk about in here really leaves me depressed and psychologically vulnerable to depression.

Getting this surgery would be more than a dream come true. For starters, I would be able to change my legal documents to female, which means that i would be able to find work without facing discrimination based on my gender identity. Even more important, this surgery means that my body and mind will be harmonious because for once i would be able to look at my body with contentment and love instead of pain and hate. Lastly, having sex right now can be really difficult for me because i lack the right part, so this surgery would enhance my love life because i would no longer have to be uncomfortable with my body during sex. I want to make love with my partner with a vagina .

Where you (the hero) rescues the damsel in distress (me :)).

If you have any super powers at all and are able to use those super powers to donate to my cause, I have come up with some lovely perks and incentives that will show you how grateful I am for your help in changing my life for the better.

If for some reason you'd like to use your super powers to donate for a greater cause, I completely understand and respect that because I know that there are bigger issues out there. However, I know that there are lots of super heroes that would like to rescue this damsel in distress.

If you choose to use your super powers to help my cause, please remember to share my story on every social network that you have an account on, so that other super heroes can use their amazing donating abilities to help this girl pay for the right junk. Who knew that junk could save a girl's life, huh?! Crazy world we live in.

The fun part: Cost and Procedure

The sexual reassignment surgery cost varies depending on location. In the United States, based on my research, the cost of surgery ranges from $18-20,000. 

In Thailand, known as the sex change capital of the world, it ranges from $10-15,000.

Ideally, I would love to stay in the United States for surgery because I would be able to have the care and support of my loved ones. 

My health Insurance.

Unfortunately, the health insurance I currently have does not cover even a portion of the surgery, but I am grateful it at least covers labs and a percentage of my hormone regime.

Based on the amount of funds i raise thanks to all the super heroes who donate, I will choose whether I go abroad or stay at home for this life changing surgery. 

Fin

Whether you donate for this cause or not, just know that I am thankful that you chose to take the time to read my story. If you chose to donate, just know that you have changed my life drastically for the better and that I will forever be thankful to your gratitude.
