story:
The Sexual Health Centre Saskatoon (SHCS) has been an inclusive and welcoming space for all individuals, regardless of gender, orientation, or sexuality for over 40 years. Our dedicated staff, nurses, and educators handle all types of sexual health issues, queries, and provide counselling to ensure anyone can make safe, informed, and fun decisions about their sexuality. We take appointments, have drop-in clinic hours, and provide educational programming to Saskatoon schools. We sell a wide variety of high-quality sex toys at affordable prices to keep everyone’s bodies healthy.

SHCS is bursting at the seams. As our clientele continues to grow, we have made a number of changes to help accommodate this growth. We moved into new larger offices in February 2013, and we’re now serving more clientele than we ever thought we would.

Our current space does not reflect the passion and forward thinking that our organization has always been known for. Year after year we succeed in providing necessary services to our clients on a tight budget, but some things fall by the wayside: expansion of clinic services, furniture, carpeting, the general look of the space, etc. We're doing pretty well with what we have, but we hope that this campaign will enable us to spiff things up so we can elevate the feel of our space to the level of service that we’re providing to our clients. We need your help to make the space fresh, efficient, professional, and welcoming. So we are asking you to help us spruce things up! Here’s what needs to happen:

First, this carpet has got to go! SHCS offers a great number of services through our clinic, and our carpet just doesn’t work. We’re dreaming about a beautifully finished, hip concrete floor, which is economical and easy to care for. We have the quote already, and it’s possible with your help. We have a huge pool of volunteers ready and willing to help us get it up! (the carpet, that is).

Additionally, we are in need of a dedicated phlebotomy office. The family at SHCS has been growing, and we have been fortunate to add two phlebotomists to our team. But some days, there’s just not room for everyone! We have plans to renovate the unused space outside our washroom area, and transform this into a shiny new phlebotomy room.

We know there’s enough support in Saskatoon to make our goal happen ­ and even go beyond our fundraising target. If we surpass our goal, we have so many places where we can use additional funds to help our community: providing pregnancy tests, compassionate contraceptives including IUDs, condoms, purchasing new materials and resources, and ensuring our office is well-stocked to support our clientele.

We understand that not everyone can make a financial contribution. There are plenty of other ways you can support sexual health in Saskatoon: spread the word (we usually advise against spreading things, but this is an exception), or come volunteer for us. We need any and all help and would love to hear how your skills could help us out! We’ll be asking for manual labour help soon too, so start hitting the gym.

Our clients, staff, volunteers, and doctors deserve a welcoming, vibrant, and safe space to call their own. When we meet our goal, our main challenge will be to complete the renovations in a timely manner so that our clinic services are not interrupted.

We at SHCS want to do better-- for you and for the community. All we need now is your support to make our vision a reality. We can’t wait to share with you the improvements we will make to our space!

Thank you for taking the time to contribute and share our campaign. We’re incredibly excited and hope you are too. See you at the Get it Up Dance Party on October 22!
story_txt: The Sexual Health Centre Saskatoon (SHCS) has been an inclusive and welcoming space for all individuals, regardless of gender, orientation, or sexuality for over 40 years. Our dedicated staff, nurses, and educators handle all types of sexual health issues, queries, and provide counselling to ensure anyone can make safe, informed, and fun decisions about their sexuality. We take appointments, have drop-in clinic hours, and provide educational programming to Saskatoon schools. We sell a wide variety of high-quality sex toys at affordable prices to keep everyone’s bodies healthy.SHCS is bursting at the seams. As our clientele continues to grow, we have made a number of changes to help accommodate this growth. We moved into new larger offices in February 2013, and we’re now serving more clientele than we ever thought we would.Our current space does not reflect the passion and forward thinking that our organization has always been known for. Year after year we succeed in providing necessary services to our clients on a tight budget, but some things fall by the wayside: expansion of clinic services, furniture, carpeting, the general look of the space, etc. We're doing pretty well with what we have, but we hope that this campaign will enable us to spiff things up so we can elevate the feel of our space to the level of service that we’re providing to our clients. We need your help to make the space fresh, efficient, professional, and welcoming. So we are asking you to help us spruce things up! Here’s what needs to happen:First, this carpet has got to go! SHCS offers a great number of services through our clinic, and our carpet just doesn’t work. We’re dreaming about a beautifully finished, hip concrete floor, which is economical and easy to care for. We have the quote already, and it’s possible with your help. We have a huge pool of volunteers ready and willing to help us get it up! (the carpet, that is).Additionally, we are in need of a dedicated phlebotomy office. The family at SHCS has been growing, and we have been fortunate to add two phlebotomists to our team. But some days, there’s just not room for everyone! We have plans to renovate the unused space outside our washroom area, and transform this into a shiny new phlebotomy room. We know there’s enough support in Saskatoon to make our goal happen ­ and even go beyond our fundraising target. If we surpass our goal, we have so many places where we can use additional funds to help our community: providing pregnancy tests, compassionate contraceptives including IUDs, condoms, purchasing new materials and resources, and ensuring our office is well-stocked to support our clientele.We understand that not everyone can make a financial contribution. There are plenty of other ways you can support sexual health in Saskatoon: spread the word (we usually advise against spreading things, but this is an exception), or come volunteer for us. We need any and all help and would love to hear how your skills could help us out! We’ll be asking for manual labour help soon too, so start hitting the gym.Our clients, staff, volunteers, and doctors deserve a welcoming, vibrant, and safe space to call their own. When we meet our goal, our main challenge will be to complete the renovations in a timely manner so that our clinic services are not interrupted.We at SHCS want to do better-- for you and for the community. All we need now is your support to make our vision a reality. We can’t wait to share with you the improvements we will make to our space!Thank you for taking the time to contribute and share our campaign. We’re incredibly excited and hope you are too. See you at the Get it Up Dance Party on October 22!

story:
AarogyaSeva: Promoting Healthcare Volunteerism!


Toby's Story: I spent 4 weeks in India volunteering with AarogyaSeva before the devastating earthquake hit Nepal killing more than 10000 people and leaving several thousand homeless and wounded - both physically and emotionally. I spent 8 long weeks in earthquake-affected Nepal, right in the remote and mountainous yet beautiful and welcoming epicenter of the country. But 8 long weeks is not enough. Nepal continues to breathe in spasms. And the one way I can help is by improving awareness about volunteering and yes, raise funds for AarogyaSeva, the organization I worked for in Nepal."

The unprecedented Chennai rains have been devastating and we have redirected several of our resources there to strive to answer every call for help. 

Click here for more details. 


Be a Rainbow

Be a Rainbow #Stronger together T-shirts are your way of telling you care and want to support the relief efforts where ever you are.  These are made by a local business. Show your support in 4 easy steps.

1. Select No Perk when you order. 

2. Contribute $20 or more and own this t-shirt.

3. Specify a size  (S, M, L, XL) and 

4. Email your address to art@aarogyaseva.org. (Add $5 for outside India)

Volunteers putting together supplies to be shipped and distributed in chennai and Cuddalore

A medical camp in progress at Ethiraj college in Chennai. 

The list of medical camps conducted, and the services offered by AarogyaSeva volunteers including tele-consultation, counseling, blood donation and public safety messaging. 

Join me in this 2500 mile journey from San Diego, California to Boca Raton, Florida over a two month period starting from 15th October 2015. I hope to raise $10 for every mile I cycle and make a sincere appeal to all of you for your support. Your help will go a long way in helping the resilient communities who with this little support can get access to basic quality healthcare which we often take for granted. 


What We Need & What You Get

Village Health Camp

Organizing monthly visit by medical and surgical teams to conduct health camps in the villages and follow up treatments. This will be in addition to providing medical supplies for people with chronic conditions like Diabetes, Hypertension, thyroid, etc.

Your contribution of $500 or more can help us organize one camp and serve an average of 200 villagers in the earthquake affected villages of Nepal. We intend to revisit every village once in 3 months in 3 clusters of villages totaling to 12 camps in a year. This will cost us a total of $6000($2.5 per person)                                                

Comprehensive Child Health 

Conditions like anaemia, malnutrition, developmental delays, stomach worms which creates discomfort and long term impacts in children's growth and future are not only common but also easily preventable. Identifying and treating these ailments can improve health for the children as they develop into adults. 

Your contribution of $25 per child can help us provide the following services to the children in the most remote and hard to reach hilly conflict ridden areas of Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Nagaland and Manipur. 

Screening, medical records, deworming, nutrition supplements, Iron tablets, specialist consultation like ophthalmology and dental will be provided as a part of the comprehensive child health program. Awareness on menstrual hygiene, sexuality and sexual health, communicable and non-communicable diseases, nutrition and lifestyle will also be provided. We intend to reach out to 400 children at a total cost of $10000.

AarogyaSeva Volunteer Clinic in Bangalore

We are lucky to have received a generous donation of a 3500 sq.ft build room to set up a free clinic where our volunteers can offer much needed consultations to the needy right in the heart of Bangalore city. The building is now complete and ready to start serving people. 

Your contribution will help us raise $10000 to equip the space with essential basic equipment required for day-to-day functioning of the clinic. With this we hope to reach out to an average of 5000 patients in a year. 

The Impact

We have done about 115 surgeries, treated more than 8000 people, 60 medical camps, 10 children's camp and art workshops, helped with about 100 temporary shelters, distributed over 15000 sanitary hygiene kits, 200 boxes of medical and surgical supplies, 13000 tarpaulins to mention a few things. We have had over 75 volunteers including plastic and pediatric surgeons, generalists and nurses helping us out.

The work doesn't stop here. We have a long way to go and we intend to continue our activities. We wish to rebuild health posts, sub posts in about 20 villages, equip them with basic instruments and medicines for a year. We also hope to refurbish operating rooms in some hospitals. Solar grid for 2 villages with the help of rotary, street light, water tanks with motors and toilets in the colonies where we have set up temporary shelters. We will have medical teams doing follow up and treatments for about a year. We will also be hoping to take care of health needs of 10000 children in schools as a part of the comprehensive school health program.

You can help us serve 2500 villagers through the rural health camps, reach out to 400 children in the remote villages of north east India and provide free consultations to 5000 people in Bangalore.

We have so far benefited over 50000 people access quality healthcare services through our volunteer network. Our teams of dedicated volunteers are ever ready to serve and provide opportunities for others to join the team.  

Risks & Challenges

With over 10 years of hand-on experience serving the communities the AarogyaSeva team is hardworking and determined to make volunteering into a movement that can help community’s access quality healthcare at no cost or low cost. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute doesn't mean you can't help:

Just sign up to volunteer in spirit here.

Read more about us on our website or Facebook page or follow us on twitter.

Share the event on Facebook, send out mailers to your network, host an event in one of the cities enroute, organize a fundraiser, and connect us to a sponsor.
Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
My passion is helping people find relief 

I am a licensed massage therapist, yoga teacher and athlete who is introducing the world to an incredible self-therapy technique using a simple and cost effective tool. 

For much of my life I have been searching for ways to alleviate my own pain, growing up with juvenile arthritis and muscle tension.  I created a healthy lifestyle combining nutrition, exercise, and regular massage. With time, money and patience, I was able to achieve a life free of chronic pain. With spiky massage balls, I discovered a way to enjoy a sensation similar to a deep tissue massage without the cost. 

The design is ideal for healing with the hundreds of acupressure  nodules that create the kneading and pressure necessary for healing. If your using a tennis ball or lacrosse ball your halfway there. The deep pressure and spiky nodules are the missing element necessary for the muscle to deeply release and relax.  Use in between your professional massage treatments or as a stand alone. 

Today I show my clients how to use the spiky massage balls for all types of aches and pains. I have video showing step by step how to alleviate specific physical symptoms in this campaign and on my website @ www.tpswellness.com. I include a brochure of the best practices with clients as well so people can feel confident and supported in their healing process.

I teach practices for shoulder pain, low back tension, knee pain, hand tension, neck pain, head pain, foot pain, plantar fasciitis, using this revolutionary and simple product. Its a joy to see the looks on peoples faces when they find relief from pain, tension or tightness.  Creating happy and healthy clients make my efforts so rewarding.

The spiky massage balls are fun and easy to use. You don't need to take off your cloths, in fact its easier and better to wear a layer or two of loose fitted clothes. They can be used at any time and offer soothing relief. Put 2 in your gym bag or stash them away anywhere.

Enjoy the healing, I remind clients

I have a degree in Business Marketing and have worked for 7 years as a commercial lender at a local Chicago bank. My department was dissolved when lending stopped in 2012. During this time I decided to follow my desires and passions in the field of health and wellness. I traveled to Asia and India, becoming certified to teach yoga, meditation, and bodywork. I learned more about healing myself and others dealing with muscle tension. I became licensed in bodywork and opened a studio in Park Ridge, Illinois. Now I  have my own business doing what I love. I am interested in expanding my reach and knowledge of bodywork and healing techniques to others interested in personal wellness.

By contributing to my campaign we can help ourselves and others stay healthy, active and pain free. 

I have been practicing massage therapy for years and have seen the beneficial effects of self-therapy. I enjoy teaching and showing clients how to use spiky massage balls. I understand not everyone can afford professional massage therapy for relief, I give people the next best alternative with a cost effective approach. 

My overhead is low as the warehouse and production is run from my home.  Manufacturing is done overseas from a reliable source and reasonable cost. The challenge is getting the information and knowledge out to the public. How can I let more people know how to alleviate muscle tension and pain? I have challenges finding a larger audience and spreading this knowledge and experience.  The upside, I have not seen many practitioners teaching how to do self-massage and there is huge demand for do it yourself programs. 

With funding I can purchase additional inventory, brochures, creative design, advertising, attend teaching events and seminars, and hire additional help to grow my business. I am interested in funding 40,000 dollars for my business. With these contributions I can continue to expand my reach and fund my growth. I dream this project will spread over the world,

I believe contributors can feel good knowing our aim is to help people feel better, in a fun and inexpensive way. If I don't reach my goal I will feel satisfaction knowing I've informed more people how to find relief.

I have all of my family and friends around me for support as I follow my passion and dreams. I am prepared to grow awareness through my current clients, trade shows, teaching events, self-massage classes, yoga practice, my website, campaigns, and other avenues I find beneficial to those searching for relief.

We can feel great pride together as we teach the world best practices for health and wellness.

story:
What weight should I choose? 

We recommend 10% of your body weight. 

Light; Ten pounds

Medium: Fifteen pounds

Heavy: Twenty pounds

The production start date should be within one month

THE PROVEN RESULTS OF DEEP TOUCH PRESSURE ( DTP ):

SEROTONIN: This is the chemical in your body that regulates your moods and helps to ease you into relaxation. If you're anything like me you need every little bit of help to relax!

MELATONIN: This is the chemical that I have the most love for, it's the one that tells your body when it is time to go to sleep! Growing up I have constantly struggled with insomnia and this blanket has absolutely been a life saver! Or sleep saver, Which ever! 

ANXIETY: The weight of the blanket helps to release multiple chemicals and to give your body the feeling of weight ( DTP ) to help ease your anxiety. This has a lot to do with our nervous system and the chemicals in it. 

INSOMNIA: Multiple studies and years of proven success in hospital settings have given the numbers to show that weighted blankets help combat the effects of insomnia. 

There are dozens more uses for the Harmony Blanket, I can honestly say that we have seen the results in our own life. 

Let me introduce you to our son Xavian.      READ MORE BELOW

 

 

This young man is now four years old, he was born disabled. He has a sensory processing disorder, seizures, cataracts, fine motor skill delay and speech difficulties. He suffered nightly from insomnia, delusional states from lack of sleep and night terrors. We first looked into weighted lap pads when he was about two and we were skeptical which was expected but we saw first hand the abilities of Deep Touch Pressure and how it forever has changed his and our lives. The night terrors ceased and the insomnia turned into a nonexistent problem now. 

We stand behind our story and thousands like it of how Deep Touch Pressure helps people, We hope you give it a try yourself. 

Please Contact Harmonyblanket@yahoo.com with any questions

story:
What's special about this product?

The TapaReef Pre-Swim Hair Mask is a unique, multifunctional, water-resistant, cream formula which is applied before swimming to seal and protect the hair from the elements, and when used with the TapaReef Baobab Oil Enriched Shampoo and Conditioner leaves post-swim hair soft and rejuvenated.

Baobab protein is the key ingredient of the TapaReef haircare line. This unique anti-aging treatment sustainably sourced from the seed of the iconic African Baobab “tree of life” provides intense protection from UV-stress & heat, helps prolong color and keratin treatments and deeply nourishes hair for greater manageability and reduced breakage during wet combing.  The products are manufactured in Australia and are free of sulphates, parabens, PEGs and silicone.

In tests conducted on hair that had been relaxed, colored or bleached then treated with Baobab Tein NPNF™ , up to 10% improvement in elasticity and 29% improvement in strength was observed and up to 10% reduction in frizz.  In tests on hair that was placed in a UV chamber,   Baobab Tein NPNF ™ treatment  was found to protect hair from UV degradation for up to 16 hours. 

How does it work?

What's in it?

The TapaReef Pre and Post Swim Hair Care is made from plant oils that contain essential amino acids, vitamins and natural UV protection to protect and condition hair.  The products contain no sulphates, parabens, PEGs or silicone.

 

What Do We Need?

We are now looking to raise $30,000 through a pre-order and perks campaign to fund the production of the second manufacturing run of 5,000 units.  It is important to our core philosophy that we source our products and packaging from Australian and U.S. suppliers so we can ensure the quality and sustainability of our components.  This results in an awesome product but comes at an increased cost. Pre-orders from our supporters will allow us to order a higher quantity of units thereby receiving a volume discount that directly impacts our ability to provide our loyal customers with an ongoing supply at the best price possible.

 

What Will You Get?

About us

Our team are passionate surfers, travellers and outdoor sports enthusiasts. TapaReef is incorporated in Florida, USA and NSW, Australia.  We believe you can be adventurous at any age or skill level and should still be able to look good while living your dream. We are constantly looking for ways to simplify an active lifestyle and have created this company to develop a line of custom formulated personal care products to meet the needs of the surf/sport/travel community.

Our proven experience

Our first product TapaReef Sunscreen Remover facial towelettes was launched in October 2015.  These facial wipes were specifically developed to remove zinc and water resistant sunscreen after swimming, surfing or other water sports.  The biodegradable and compostable towelettes are manufactured in the U.S. from all natural ingredients that contain fruit extracts, antioxidants and anti-inflammatories designed for after-sun skin care.  They are currently sold on our website www.tapareef.com, Amazon.com and select retail outlets and are promoted by professional surfers both in the U.S. and Australia.

Stage one fully funded

The TapaReef Pre and Post Swim Hair Care range has been more than two years in creation; involving collaboration with a cosmetic chemist, manufacturer and packaging supplier to develop a proprietary formula using natural ingredients with low environmental impact to  protect and restore hair both before and after going in the ocean or pool. The first run of 1,000 units of  the TapaReef Pre-Swim Hair Mask and TapaReef Baobab Oil Enriched Shampoo and Conditioner will be ready for shipping to Australia in May 2017 and to the U.S. in June 2017.

Stage two completed

Manufacturing for the TapaReef Pre and Post Swim Hair Care is completed and the products are now available for sale in Australia and a shipment arriving into the U.S. on June 3, 2017 ready for immediate shipping.

Impact

With your support, we can continue to develop and manufacture products to help active people live big, look good and look after themselves and the planet with products that protect skin and hair from exposure to the environment's harsher elements but with minimal environmental impact.

In addition, TapaReef will donate 1% of sales to  1% For The Planet, a global network of businesses, nonprofits and individuals working together for a healthy planet. The non-profit organisation started  in 2002 by Yvon Chouinard (founder of Patagonia) and Craig Mathews (founder of Blue Ribbon Flies) to date has given over $150 Million dollars back to the environment by connecting dollars with doers to help create partnerships that protect the planet.

 

Help us spread the word!

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools at the top of the campaign page to share  our campaign and #TapaReef with your friends on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter 
     
  • Like us on https://www.facebook.com/tapareef/ and https://www.instagram.com/tapareef/
     
  • Visit our website https://www.tapareef.com OR https://www.tapareef.com.au for more information
     
  • Send us an email at info@tapareef.com if you are retailer interested in stocking our products
story_txt:
What's special about this product?
The TapaReef Pre-Swim Hair Mask is a unique, multifunctional, water-resistant, cream formula which is applied before swimming to seal and protect the hair from the elements, and when used with the TapaReef Baobab Oil Enriched Shampoo and Conditioner leaves post-swim hair soft and rejuvenated.
Baobab protein is the key ingredient of the TapaReef haircare line. This unique anti-aging treatment sustainably sourced from the seed of the iconic African Baobab “tree of life” provides intense protection from UV-stress & heat, helps prolong color and keratin treatments and deeply nourishes hair for greater manageability and reduced breakage during wet combing.  The products are manufactured in Australia and are free of sulphates, parabens, PEGs and silicone.

In tests conducted on hair that had been relaxed, colored or bleached then treated with Baobab Tein NPNF™ , up to 10% improvement in elasticity and 29% improvement in strength was observed and up to 10% reduction in frizz.  In tests on hair that was placed in a UV chamber,   Baobab Tein NPNF ™ treatment  was found to protect hair from UV degradation for up to 16 hours. 
How does it work?


What's in it?
The TapaReef Pre and Post Swim Hair Care is made from plant oils that contain essential amino acids, vitamins and natural UV protection to protect and condition hair.  The products contain no sulphates, parabens, PEGs or silicone.


 

What Do We Need?
We are now looking to raise $30,000 through a pre-order and perks campaign to fund the production of the second manufacturing run of 5,000 units.  It is important to our core philosophy that we source our products and packaging from Australian and U.S. suppliers so we can ensure the quality and sustainability of our components.  This results in an awesome product but comes at an increased cost. Pre-orders from our supporters will allow us to order a higher quantity of units thereby receiving a volume discount that directly impacts our ability to provide our loyal customers with an ongoing supply at the best price possible.
 
What Will You Get?



About us
Our team are passionate surfers, travellers and outdoor sports enthusiasts. TapaReef is incorporated in Florida, USA and NSW, Australia.  We believe you can be adventurous at any age or skill level and should still be able to look good while living your dream. We are constantly looking for ways to simplify an active lifestyle and have created this company to develop a line of custom formulated personal care products to meet the needs of the surf/sport/travel community.
Our proven experience
Our first product TapaReef Sunscreen Remover facial towelettes was launched in October 2015.  These facial wipes were specifically developed to remove zinc and water resistant sunscreen after swimming, surfing or other water sports.  The biodegradable and compostable towelettes are manufactured in the U.S. from all natural ingredients that contain fruit extracts, antioxidants and anti-inflammatories designed for after-sun skin care.  They are currently sold on our website www.tapareef.com, Amazon.com and select retail outlets and are promoted by professional surfers both in the U.S. and Australia.
Stage one fully funded
The TapaReef Pre and Post Swim Hair Care range has been more than two years in creation; involving collaboration with a cosmetic chemist, manufacturer and packaging supplier to develop a proprietary formula using natural ingredients with low environmental impact to  protect and restore hair both before and after going in the ocean or pool. The first run of 1,000 units of  the TapaReef Pre-Swim Hair Mask and TapaReef Baobab Oil Enriched Shampoo and Conditioner will be ready for shipping to Australia in May 2017 and to the U.S. in June 2017.
Stage two completed
Manufacturing for the TapaReef Pre and Post Swim Hair Care is completed and the products are now available for sale in Australia and a shipment arriving into the U.S. on June 3, 2017 ready for immediate shipping.

Impact

With your support, we can continue to develop and manufacture products to help active people live big, look good and look after themselves and the planet with products that protect skin and hair from exposure to the environment's harsher elements but with minimal environmental impact.
In addition, TapaReef will donate 1% of sales to  1% For The Planet, a global network of businesses, nonprofits and individuals working together for a healthy planet. The non-profit organisation started  in 2002 by Yvon Chouinard (founder of Patagonia) and Craig Mathews (founder of Blue Ribbon Flies) to date has given over $150 Million dollars back to the environment by connecting dollars with doers to help create partnerships that protect the planet.

 
Help us spread the word!

Use the Indiegogo share tools at the top of the campaign page to share  our campaign and #TapaReef with your friends on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter  
Like us on https://www.facebook.com/tapareef/ and https://www.instagram.com/tapareef/ 
Visit our website https://www.tapareef.com OR https://www.tapareef.com.au for more information 
Send us an email at info@tapareef.com if you are retailer interested in stocking our products

story:
Jacquie Miller, RN, AD, a nurse with 38+ Years Experience

As a critical care registered nurse with over 35 years of experience, I identified several problems that affect the immobility impaired, and those who care for them.  I developed a mobility solution that helps to prevent falls, increase user independence, and decrease the high cost of workers compensation.

Bob Miller, BSME, MSME, MBA, an engineer with 40+ Years Experience

My husband, Bob, is a mechanical engineer, with 40+ years of engineering & manufacturing experience. His product evaluation and input has been invaluable. We are a team both personally, and professionally, and together we strive to solve the identified issues.

Our Mission

We embrace the World Health Organization's motto, in that we focus "on the abilities, not the disabilities", of the physically disabled.  At this moment in time, over a billion people world wide, suffer from some form of disability. There are over 75 million baby boomers in the U.S. alone.  A growing aging population combined with an increase in longevity, equals a growing population of individuals with chronic illnesses. I am personally passionate about preventing the conditions that immobility produces.  If only we could measure the number of people who don't end up needing medical treatment for complications associated with aging and chronic illness, and the number of people who don't fall when they try to get up and perform their activities of daily living! That would be priceless.  I don't have those statistics, but the NuWynd can be a solution for countless individuals, caregivers and institutions.

Regain Mobility and Reduce Injuries

By purchasing and using a NuWynd, someone is being given an opportunity to achieve or maintain independence.  Someone may have a reason to smile, and feel worthy. Someone may not fall, be hospitalized, nor die.  A caregiver might avoid an injury.  Help us to make that a reality.

Funds Usage

The funds that we are requesting will help us to continue to improve the product. Colorful diamond plating for the standing platform will make it easier for Alzheimer's and dementia patients to use.  Accessories, like motion detection, that will result in lighted handles or floor platform, will make the NuWynd safer to use at night.

Donate and Help Others

Greater Mobility, Inc. desires to give to those who cannot help themselves. We have set in place the opportunity for you to donate a NuWynd to an individual or charity of your choice. Marion Senior Services, who provides meals, transportation and in home support for identified individuals over 60 years old, will be the recipient of unspecified donations.  With every purchase of a NuWynd, we will send the perks shown.  Donors who are able to contribute $1200 or more, will have their name on a plaque which is attached to the donated unit, and will receive a corresponding certificate of appreciation.

Help Us Scale Up

One of the challenges that we are working to overcome, is gaining the attention of risk managers, group purchasing organizations, and corporate purchasing contacts for hospitals, assisted living and skilled nursing facilities and rehabilitation centers.  If you see the merit in our efforts, please use the Indiegogo tools to share our information

Description

The NuWynd is constructed to be strong, yet light.  The handles are a 4130 steel alloy used in roll cages and light aircraft frames.  The base platform, legs, etc. are 6160 aluminum alloy also used in light aircraft frames.  The current weight capacity is estimated to be 400-600 pounds and is currently being tested by a certification agency.

The real magic to the NuWynd is it easily rolls, yet collapses to the floor thanks to its recessed spring loaded wheels.

 

Thank you for helping us to focus on abilities vs. disabilities!

story:
https://www.thegreatwideopenproject.com
 

We are Lacey Leonard and Andrew Franklin. After hiking the Appalachian Trail, We had to find ways of staying fit physically and finding peace with ourselves and others as we re-entered society. We began running, climbing, and practicing meditation with our community and found that it not only helped us maintain our fitness level but also made us feel creatively energized.

As artists, we are constantly trying to find ways of seeing and doing things a little differently. This is our approach with The Great Wide Open.

With the funding from this campaign, we will be able to create entirely new ways of experiencing the outdoors, our community, and overall well-being.

Our goal is to make these practices accessible in our geographical location and have the online presence to reach a wider community.

What We Need & What You Get

The Great Wide Open needs 35,000 dollars for one year of operating costs, a unique gear inventory, and specialty certifications to insure the safety of our participants and viewers.

  • We will offer weekly training, monthly adventures, and customized outdoor event planning (plan the perfect proposal!!)
  • If we are unable to reach our goal, the funding will go to obtaining our certifications so that we can still offer our perspective to individuals online and within our community.

The Impact

Your contribution will pave the way for experimental recreation.One of our bigger goals is to offer recreational therapy to individuals with disabilities. 

  • Combining music and meditation with activities that challenge our bodies can create a space where teamwork and self- actualization can thrive.
  • The Great Wide Open can exist in other geographical areas as well as have a strong online presence

    Risks & Challenges

The Great Wide Open faces the challenge of becoming too specific.

  • We are young and open-minded. We welcome challenges and we aren't afraid of sticking with something. We've got 2,189.1 miles behind us to prove it.
  • We plan to take input from our online viewers and community participants about the content and types of activities that we provide while remaining true to the nature of our project.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute to our project, but you like our idea, please spread the word!

Like us on Facebook and follow us on Instagram!

Check out the website HERE

If in doubt, Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

I think everyone’s gym bag has a work out glove to protect your hands and probably some wraps for your wrists (elbows knees) when maxing out with heavy weights.

The basis for the creation of this product came from the lack of a durable glove with wrist wraps that actually uses the right material for support.  

Searching through all the sporting goods stores both online and offline, I cannot find one product that matches my needs. 

What I had to do in the past is to wear a wrist wrap with another glove.  So spending twice the money to have a non functional, ugly, and uncomfortable set up.   Since I can’t find a real 2 in 1 glove, I decided to simply create one.  

The key to quality is simply the material used.  We ensure that not only wraps are at the highest quality but also the hand gloves are as durable as you can find.  I personally workout 5-6 times a week (sometimes twice a day). Pervious experiences with inferior gloves lasts about 2-3 months.  

Our prototypes have gone through 9 months of vigorous and unrelenting true life cycle testing.  So far they are still holding up in good shape and functioning great.

The objective of this project is to provide a simple all in one product to protect your wrist and palm at the same time.   So please support our project, put one on, protect what matters and hit some weights.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The funding will cover the minimum order quantity on the custom ordered wrap material as well as the micro fiber palm material.  
  • The funds will go towards getting the raw material.  We will continue with the project even if we fail.  You will get your products regardless.  (delivery time might be delayed a bit)

 

Risks & Challenges

There's no risk!  We are professional in designing and managing production for over a decade and this product will be delivered once the campaign is over.   

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please get the words out make some noise about our campaign!  

Share our project with your friends.

story:
Yoga for wellness Tanzanian was conceived about 3 years ago when I spent about 9 months taking care of my father in the hospital. During this time the only thing that got us both through this difficult time was Yoga (breathing techniques and meditation). 

Yoga for Wellness Tanzania was born last year with the mission to introduce through training and development/education (teacher training programs),  the awareness of the benefits to be derived from the practice of holistic care, yoga principles and methods in terms of well-being and healthy living. Thus Impacting not only our students or participants, but also their communities, and our society.

What We Have Done:

We have completed our first pilot project. With our first teacher training program our graduates are now spreading the knowledge of love of yoga, providing information to communities on wellbeing through yoga, health benefits and reduction in medical costs.  

Two of our graduates are now teaching recovering women with Fistula and are focusing on helping women within their communities who are under privileged. These graduates have found their calling and are spreading their wings with yoga.

Yoga for Wellness Tanzania ongoing training and development programmes have been developed to ensure we have readily available members, workshops and sessions that make a true impact through connection, empathy and understanding with people.

What We Need

Funding for a 12 month project which will include 2 teacher training programs and a minimum of 4 regional training sessions.

The resources needed for the teacher training programme include:

  • Trainer costs
  • Travel costs/Accommodation for trainer
  • Material for training
  • Transport for participants
  • Certificate

To run the project we need:

  • Transport to regions within Tanzania
  • Accommodation during travel
  • Material for participants (yoga mats)
  • Allowance for trainers
  • Rent for space

To reach our goal we have worked out the following budget:

Above budget will enable a minimum of 20 participants per training cycle which will include the following:

  • 100 hours of community service per participant (education or health institute)
  • Certificates upon completion of training and community service
  • Ongoing training at Yoga for Wellness Tanzania (holistic/yoga)
  • Thorough understanding of holistic care/yoga health benefits and wellbeing

What you get:

You will be a part of the Yoga for Wellness Tanzania community and a part of a ground breaking upheaval of healing through community integration and peace for the underprivileged within Tanzania (urban and regional)

 

A little more about us:

Yoga for Wellness Tanzania first teacher training program:

Graduates from our first teacher training program who had the opportunity to participate on stage in Dar-es-Salaam Tanzania during the International Day of Yoga 2016.

 

 

 

Fistula girls taking on the community project:

Teacher training graduates have completed their community service and are now certified yoga instructors who are teaching within the community other women with fistula, family and friends

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Holistic care is something that is just bring brought forward to the larger populace of Tanzania. With the large population being under the poverty line it has been challenging for us to able to show the benefits and importance of healthy living through yoga and holistic care. It is a cultural change and therefore, obtaining funding for projects such as this one are also challenging. People are not yet seeing the bigger picture and how this form of change can lead to a better social, economic and personal life. Making “our society” a peaceful and healthier place to live.

As Nelson Mandela said, “Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.’ This is exactly what we are doing. Educate the people and spread the love of healthy living.

We have seen an increase in people wanting to learn and seeing the benefits, as long as we have “YOUR” support we will keep on going. We will keep educating, doing yoga sessions, healthy living workshops, connecting and building our loving community without gender prejudice, discrimination or basis, only positive energy and love.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know it is not always easy to contribute and everyone has responsibilities. Whatever is possible is appreciated even taking a little time out to spread our message, what we do for other people will only help. The more people who know the more chances of us making peoples dreams in Tanzania come true.

Let us work on being the change. Spread the need to find the balance in our life – health, energy and peace.

Spread the word!

story:
My name is Hamish Ganga, the CEO & Founder of MobiPT. I came here from France 18 years ago and have been a personal trainer over 10 years. I've also owned studios while helping thousands of people in Minnesota and Chicago.

I've always heard people complain about how they wish they could have their trainer while traveling. Well, now it's possible. Not only that, through MobiPT you can train in Chicago, fly to San Francisco and the trainer there will know exactly what you did in Chicago. Through our app trainers are able to enter workouts and add notes for the next session with your trainer. This allows the trainer to prepare a workout for you and avoid the risk of injury.

My followers on social media have always inspired me and I would be honored to have the community's energy tied into this app. I truly believe in building something successful through the people -  that's meant to serve and not the other way around.

I want to be able to say "people have showed us how much they want this app out there".

What We Need & What You Get

We need $500K to prove the model and while we are raising funds from venture capital firms. It is important to me that I involve the community. We need to recruit more trainers, expand the hotels we have and optimize the app.

Some donations result in a top trainer/massage therapist meeting you in your hotel for an hour. Also, you can get me, Hamish, to fly to your location and train you a few times, cook a healthy meal and speak to the famous model/actor Tyson Beckford. 

If we don't reach our entire goal we'll still fund the development of the app and work on marketing it through our network of hotels.

The Impact

Americans are is battling obesity. Largely due to the fact people don't exercise enough and eat poorly. The MobiPT app will impact into the lives of the busy dad or mom who spend 50-80% of the time traveling to feed their family.

I've helped thousands of people change their lives, owned 3 gyms in MN and expanded in Chicago. I know what people need in order to stay motivated.

You can go to the iTunes App store or Google Play and download 'MobiPT'; the app is available for free today. We have over 50 hotels in Chicago, New York City, Boston and Minneapolis combined. We need to recruit more trainers and service the accounts we have.

Risks & Challenges

People value transparency and trust. My mindset is "be open and stand out by providing insight about risks and obstacles you may face while achieving a goal."

What makes us special is that we have the ability to leverage celebrities and change lives. They will enable us to make this app successful with their audience and their reach.

Other Ways You Can Help

What's important is for you to help us spread the word. Tell your friends and repost on your Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat and Twitter. You would be surprised by the number of friends will find the MobiPT app useful.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you all!

Hamish

CEO & Founder of MobiPT

Well, now it's possible. Not only that, through MobiPT you can train in Chicago, fly to San Francisco and the trainer there will know exactly what you did in Chicago. Through our app trainers are able to enter workouts and add notes for the next session with your trainer. This allows the trainer to prepare a workout for you and avoid the risk of injury.My followers on social media have always inspired me and I would be honored to have the community's energy tied into this app. I truly believe in building something successful through the people -  that's meant to serve and not the other way around.I want to be able to say "people have showed us how much they want this app out there".What We Need & What You GetWe need $500K to prove the model and while we are raising funds from venture capital firms. It is important to me that I involve the community. We need to recruit more trainers, expand the hotels we have and optimize the app.Some donations result in a top trainer/massage therapist meeting you in your hotel for an hour. Also, you can get me, Hamish, to fly to your location and train you a few times, cook a healthy meal and speak to the famous model/actor Tyson Beckford. If we don't reach our entire goal we'll still fund the development of the app and work on marketing it through our network of hotels.The ImpactAmericans are is battling obesity. Largely due to the fact people don't exercise enough and eat poorly. The MobiPT app will impact into the lives of the busy dad or mom who spend 50-80% of the time traveling to feed their family.I've helped thousands of people change their lives, owned 3 gyms in MN and expanded in Chicago. I know what people need in order to stay motivated.You can go to the iTunes App store or Google Play and download 'MobiPT'; the app is available for free today. We have over 50 hotels in Chicago, New York City, Boston and Minneapolis combined. We need to recruit more trainers and service the accounts we have.Risks & ChallengesPeople value transparency and trust. My mindset is "be open and stand out by providing insight about risks and obstacles you may face while achieving a goal."What makes us special is that we have the ability to leverage celebrities and change lives. They will enable us to make this app successful with their audience and their reach.Other Ways You Can HelpWhat's important is for you to help us spread the word. Tell your friends and repost on your Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat and Twitter. You would be surprised by the number of friends will find the MobiPT app useful.Please use the Indiegogo share tools.Thank you all!HamishCEO & Founder of MobiPT

story:
Globale Medicum Insurance is the first insurance company that covers alternative medical treatments in the world. Now, allow us share our revolutionary story with you.

More than sixteen years ago Dr. Rickard Briggs D.el started our first healthcare company designed to help people find medical procedures around the world at an affordable cost (AMS). As we built our network of hospitals, research centers and doctors; we made numerous exciting discoveries. The most enlightening was the advancement of new and experiential medical treatments, surgeries and therapies.

Only after years of navigating the global healthcare community we came to understand why many of these new lifesaving and quality of life improving procedures were not being utilized. We started to understand the limitations, circumstances and reasons for the lack of information and communication. The holistic answer: Many countries, healthcare communities and governmental agencies have yet to adapt to a new global healthcare community.

Once we identified the problem our mission became to establish a database to communicate on a global level and in multiple tiers this mass amount of information.  As we researched extensively over the next decade we were able to develop a plan to not only provide the information for a global healthcare network, but to fund it as well. The result is Globale Medicum Insurance (GMI) and its subsidiaries. 

 

At the core of our insurance company is this: do the right thing, for the right reason and with a purposeful heart. It is the founding principle of GMI and our driving force. Our success lies not in the profitability of a company, but rather in the benefit we offer to those in need. We have been inspired by witnessing people who were told there was no hope or they would not walk, see, hear or have a normal life and defied their medical prognosis and survive.

We believe each person has the opportunity and obligation to create change to better the world we live in. Globale Medicum Insurance has been created to initially provide coverage for “experimental”, “investigational” and “New” treatments. By offering a financial solution and opportunities for people to secure treatment that would otherwise be unavailable or unknown in their country of origin we start the journey of changing the way healthcare and insurance companies operate.

By creating a platform of communication, information, assistance and services we do insurance differently and with a long term objective to creating a new medical paradigm for international healthcare.

Our success is validated with every patient who’s life if saved or improved.

 

CEO & Founder - Dr. Rickard Briggs, D. el

Raised in New York City and with over thirty five years of business creation, executive- leadership, global healthcare facilitation, academic instruction, international business management and development. Dr. Briggs has devoted his life to the creation of business designed to assist others. Incorporating creative an innovative approaches to new problems as well as redefining and reframing old ones. In so doing he has amassed an insurmountable amount of practical and educational experience. Hence, Dr. Briggs is also an accomplished author and professor focused on transferring his experiences and knowledge to others.

 

CMO & Co-founder - LDE - Rene A. Cossio Corrales

Graduated from Monterrey Institute of Technology and Higher Education with the specialty in Entrepreneurship & Business Development . Co-founder & CMO - Globale Medicum Insurace, Co-founder & CEO - Expand It Now, Co-founder & CEO - Crowdie. Started as an entrepreneur since 15 years old, Developed companies like: Cossio´s Music, Intercode, Partysound, Iplug-u, Spotor, Crowdbackup, Crowdie, Emporio Sound, Expand It Now, Affordable Medical Services S.C., Mexico.

 

 

 

  • Create a Crowdequity Campaign (Monthly fee required)
  • Create a professional video pitch for our Crowdequity Campaign.
  • Increase our brand awareness.
  • Realize four trips to see potential investors from Pittsburgh to: New York City, Houston, TX., and Washington, D.C., Mexico City, MX.

 

If you want to raise your chances of survival against "incurable diseases" by the common medical treatments - GMI is for you.

We believe GMI is a must for all the people worldwide, it is an opportunity of survival, its just the right thing to do.

Even if you think that our actual products from GMI are not for you, you may support us getting an awesome reward.

When you become a GMI member you are not just helping out people all over the world by saving their lives. You also become eligible for a vast array of member benefits, discounts and opportunities.

Membership in Globale Medicum Insurance is a condition precedent or prerequisite to your ability to apply for and to renew insurance

Let us describe our products offered by GMI. (Our Insurance Premiums will be available once the Crowdequity Campaign is finished),

Here you can find a short list of the medical procedures we provide on Affordable Medical Services. 

*We are still working on the T-shirt, Hoodie, Mug, Sticker, Calendar awesome design. But do not worry, these perks are available since now.*

Membership designed to those who need information about our facilitation and procedures worldwide.

Get access to all the information about the existing procedures all around the world. We also refer you with the right people who can take care of you and support you anytime needed.

 

Membership designed to those who need the coverage of an insurance by their sides.

Get the right to use all of our services offered by Globale Medicum Insurance. Please see or clic the image below.

You will have the right to use all of our services offered by Globale Medicum. This also includes a 25% discount in the purchase of your premium. The premium will be no cheaper than $2,000 annually and will be available in December, 2017.

 

 

                                

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

If you have any question, want to contribute with us or would like to know more about this company, please feel free to contact us.

Who can be a member?

Anyone can be a GMI member and take advantage of exclusive discounts and savings. Our members come from all walks of life, and share common values like family, productivity and quality of life.

Can I invest by equity in this company?

Of course! We will be running our Crowd Equity Campaign after we finish this campaign, then you´ll be able to invest with us. Keep in touch by pledging.

What are the risk and challenges in this project?

We believe we are like a Microsoft, Apple, Uber, Facebook were when they first started, but in the insurance industry. We have an opportunity in a blue ocean where the window is very little. And we have been preparing ourselves for years to defeat this challenge.

Has an insurance company done this before?

There is no record of an insurance company covering alternative medical procedures around the world. We are the only and first one that will be able to cover them.

 

Other ways to contribute.

Spreading the word- each share, repost, like, or tag will directly affect our ability to help people all over the world! Help us spreading the word!

 

Lastly, thank you for your time. We believe in you and "Together, we will change the world".

story:
My Story

I, Nekia Wright, am an educator, musician, healing facilitator, and academic, emotional and spiritual coach. I was deeply impacted by traumatic childhood experiences that stemmed from inequity, lack of access to proper mental, emotional, and physical health services, and police targeting. I refused to allow these circumstances to determine my life. I completed a Bachelor's in Communication Studies as a ward of the state until the age of 21 and a Master's Degree in Special Education. I am also trained in Positive Behavior Support, Seeking Safety (Counseling for PTSD and Addiction), and Responsive Classroom. I've taught in international schools in Australia, Guatemala, and Panama, managed and environmental education program, and developed curriculum materials for The Nature Conservancy. My emotional health had always been a concern and after near liver failure in 2010, I began seriously investigating holistic options and incorporating sound into my holistic practice in 2013 and it has transformed my life.

What I've Accomplished Thus Far

After about a year of self healing with sound I began offering sound massages to others. I was ecstatic to find that so many people found relief through this service. I was traveling at the time and after serving over 100 people, I decided to return to the US and identify a way to make this accessible to undeserved communities. Within one month of arriving to San Francisco, I had secured a part-time position at the YMCA in the Bayview/Hunter's Point community. I currently work about 7.5 hrs a week and serve community members at the YMCA site and at the Dr. George Davis Senior Center workshops are free for San Francisco residents and YMCA members. I would like to expand this project into my own business. 

I have served over 200 people in the last two years on a donation/pay what you can basis in three different countries.

In the last year:

  • I started the first sound healing program at the SF YMCA and George Davis Senior Center and it is FREE for all San Francisco residents.
  • I forged relationships between local cannabis businesses and holistic health. Making sound healing available to patients.
  • I connected with local artists and events and have offered free sound healing for non-profit workers in Oakland and on a donation base for patrons, meditation, and self-healing groups. Example, Yoga to Live Music.
  • My position at the YMCA is the first of it's kind.I created a job in an emerging industry with a national non-profit. If this project is successful, there is potential for many more jobs for many more people at other YMCA.
  • Applied for a fellowship that will provide start-up capital and business coaching.

I am absolutely positive that I am doing my life's work, holistic services should be available to under-served communities. Unfortunately this mission is not valued by the mainstream and I have had to make many sacrifices.

Emotional health is of the utmost importance. Sound healing alongside emotional coaching offers an opportunity for community members to come together and heal themselves. These services are rarely offered at affordable rates.

What We Need & What You Get

Business License and P.O. Box: $1000

Transportation Costs and Vehicle Maintenance : $2300

Instruments and CD and Mp3 Development: $500

Training and Certificates: $1000

Website hosting and domain: $200

Any extra funding will go towards sponsorship for clients who cannot afford the individual or group rate and are unable to attend the free community workshops.

The Impact

Your contribution will assist under-served communities in healing generations of trauma. 

Risks & Challenges

I have overcome several of the challenges to running a holistic health business over the last couple of years. One of my major challenges was identifying organizations that would pay me to offer this service to community members at a free or reduced rate. I have connected with the YMCA and a couple of local small business that pay me to serve their clients. 

Another major challenge is community buy-in. People in undeserved communities do not have access to many holistic health options and are therefore very cautious when trying new services. I have been very fortunate to have found a community that is open. 

I am a skilled curriculum and program designer. I've developed successful programming for non-profits and schools and am very excited to be developing my own program. Here is an example of a program I developed while on staff at City Blossoms for The Nature Conservancy.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share! Share! Share! With your family, friends, co-workers.

Are you a San Francisco Resident or YMCA member in the SF Bay Area? Come visit us. 

Free Self Healing with Sound Group for San Francisco Residents!

​
